dialogues.text: 40 41 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 45.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Click. End of conversation. Donnie sits up. He rubs his f then stands and claps his hands together. INT. MERRIMEN’S SUBURBAN, DOWNTOWN LA STREETS - DAY 41 Merrimen drives, pulls up to Donnie. Donnie jumps in, shotgun. Bosco and Enson in back. They ride off in silenc through the LA streets. Donnie wants to ask where they’re going, but doesn’t dare. He tries to settle in. Merrimen reaches forward, TURNS UP THE STEREO. He turns right. Drives the speed limit. Flips down the su visors. They come to a stop at a traffic light. Merrimen turns up the stereo even louder. Over the music:

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Look to your left. THEY ALL LOOK. On the corner is a BROWN MARBLE, 3 STORY BUILDING. No windows. Nondescript, yet imposing.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Know what that is? (all shake their heads) That’s the Los Angeles Branch of the Federal Reserve Bank. Light turns green. Merrimen drives, rounds the Fed and th entire city block it subsumes. MERRIMEN (CONT’D) All the surrounding streets are wired for sound and image. They read the license plate off of every car that passes by. It’s case proof. You stand across the street and stare at the building for 2 minutes, you'll have security guards on your ass asking you politely to leave. They see your face again, every Secret Service agent in the country will know who you are, and they'll be looking for you. (pause) There have been 113 attempts to break in. Not one got past the lobby... (looks to the others) That's why we’re gonna rob it. Merrimen lets this sink in, parks a safe distance from th Fed, down the street. Turns off the radio. They all study FED. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 41 42 43 44 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 46.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: MERRIMEN (CONT’D) At any one time, there’s anywhere from 50 to 85 billion dollars housed in there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SINGLE, UNINTERRUPTED FLOATING POV guides us toward the FRONT DOORS -- 20’ high, with 3” thick bulletproof glass.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: As you approach the front, cameras lock onto you, and their computers immediately run you through every law enforcement database in the country. If you’ve committed a crime anywhere in this country, they’1l know about it by the time you take step one into the lobby. CAMERA TRAVELS through the massive front doors, into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Built like a fortress. 10’ thick marble walls give the impression of stability. 40’ ceilings. 2 ARMED SECRET SER GUARDS, behind a marble SECURITY STATION, greet us.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The lobby guards sit behind a bank of monitors that cover the exterior. If their cameras don’t recognize you, and they don’t either, you'll be stopped right there. Security has two steps. First electronic, then human. All employees have both security clearance cards they wear clipped to their front shirt pocket, as well as security swipe cards granting them access through the first set of the man-traps... The Guards press UNLOCK, opening the first MAN-TRAP -- a DOUBLE-DOOR BULLETPROOF GLASS CHAMBER. ENTER MAN-TRAP #1.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door behind automatically locks, sealing us inside. A HAND reaches into frame and SWIPES A SECURITY CARD throug card reader. Then the hand places itself on a FLAT GLASS SURFACE. A laser can be seen “reading” the hand. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 44 45 46 47 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 47.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: In the first man-trap, a hand scan reads the fingerprint of all five fingers, as well as your palm print... POV pans down. A pair of feet stand on a BLACK, SQUARE TI

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And at the same time, the pressure sensitive floor beneath you measures your weight. If any of that information isn’t an exact match with the information stored on your access card, the second door will not open. POV pans back up. The red light above turns to GREEN. The glass door before us opens with a buzzing SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SECRET SERVICE GUARDS #3 and #4 sit inside a bulletproof office. They wave “hello” to us.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And if either of these guards didn’t recognize you, they can override your security clearance and keep you locked inside the mantrap.

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE GUARD
dialogues.text: Morning. What floor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifth. The guard opens the ELEVATOR DOORS. POV CAMERA moves insi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No floor indicator buttons in this elevator. Nothing but steel walls and a camera high up in the corner. The elevator goes down. The doors open.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The vault is 5 floors beneath the city streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV moves into a second man-trap station. The card swipes opening the first door. Into the man-trap. Door shuts beh us. Ahead, the SECURITY NERVE CENTER is seen -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 47 48 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 48.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 5 SECRET SERVICE GUARDS sit before a bay of 25 SECURITY SCREENS. MAPS of the surrounding streets lie on a central table. AR-15s and RIOT SHOTGUNS are lined across the wall Move forward inside the man-trap through a METAL DETECTOR

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: On the vault floor is central security - the nerve center for The Fed. Inside the final man-trap, you pass through a metal detector, and once you’ve cleared, all doors from this point on can only be opened after visual recognition from the guards, as access is severely restricted. The final man-trap door buzzes open. POV moves into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vault. CAMERAS loom overhead. The Guards wave to us a the POV moves down a long hallway. What is most striking about this cavernous, vast space, is that ALL THE WALLS A MADE OF PLEXIGLASS, rendering every room “see-thru”. POV passes by the ARMORED CAR RECEIVING AND SHIPPING DOCK where ARMORED CAR PERSONNEL deliver CLEAR MONEY TUBS fill with cash to FED EMPLOYEES, always working in TEAMS OF TW

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is where it all happens, where the armored car companies deliver their scheduled drops. The money tubs carry anywhere from 3 to 30 million each, depending upon denomination. They're passed onto the Fed employees who always work in two’s -- the “buddy system”, which ensures no one will grift, because if one dollar goes missing, they both lose their jobs. The Fed employees roll the tubs through a series of man- traps, PUNCHING IN CODES at each station, GREEN LIGHTS flashing in response, opening finally into the hallway. T tubs are rolled up to the VAULT LOADING BAY.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The tubs are brought to the vault’s loading bay, where they’re touched for the last time by human hands. At the bay, the tubs are inserted into a MECHANIZED TURNSTILE, that feeds the tubs to ROBOTIC FORKLIFTS. Thes forklifts transport the tubs into the PEOPLE-LESS VAULT. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 48 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 49.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The vault is entirely people-less. Mechanized forklifts transport the tubs into the vault and store them with the other 5 to 6 thousand that have been deposited by banks from all over Southern California. Billions in deposited cash. POV MOVES IN on the VAULT. A massive, CAVERNOUS SPACE lin by imposing steel walls. The money tubs are staked 20 hig reaching to the ceiling 50’ above. Literal MOUNTAINS OF MONEY. It’s an astonishing sight -- an army of robotic forklifts, ever-moving, filling the air with a constant ELECTRONIC HUM.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Every last inch of it covered by cameras, infra-red sensors, motion detectors. 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, 365 days a year... Because money never sleeps. POV swings away from the vault, back down the hallway...

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The serial number of every bill in the vault is recorded in the Fed’s system. If a note goes missing, they'll know exactly which one it is, and they'll flag it. If and when that bill turns up again, whoever recirculated that cash, no matter where they are in the world, can be tracked down. The BANKNOTE COUNT ROOMS -- 6 of them, TWO MAN TEAMS insi FEEDING NOTES INTO HUGE BANKNOTE COUNTING MACHINES. Notic something we’ve seen before -- engraved in small print al the side of the counting-machine are the words, “HOLZWERK GMACH"”.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But, there’s a hitch. When the Fed receives a deposit from a bank, the first thing they do is bring the notes into the count rooms, and run the notes through their counting machines. They're accomplishing two things here. One, they're double-checking the accuracy of the banks’ deposit, and if the bank was off, they will credit or debit their account accordingly. SOME NOTES ARE DIVIDED FROM THE REST, spit out into a CLE TUBE. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 48 49 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 50.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And two, they're separating newer, fit bills from old, unfit currency. Bills so old and limp, you get an argument from the towel-head at 7-11 because he won’t accept it... But most importantly, they're erasing the serial numbers of these old bills from the Fed’s database in the process. POV follows the last TWO MAN TEAM as they walk down the hallway, munching on CHINESE TAKE-OUT. They are LUIGI, 30 black dude with chops, and JUNIOR, 28, a Salvadorean who' always laughing. They approach the 100 DOLLAR BANKNOTE CO ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Once those numbers are erased, to the Fed, and to the rest of the world, that money has ceased to exist. They punch in a code, get a green light, and the man-trap opens. POV follows them into the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man-trap door seals shut behind them. Luigi and Junio crank Power 106, rap along to every track DJ Big Boy play while feeding 100 dollar notes into the counting machine.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: 72,000 bills are counted an hour. And in the 100 dollar banknote count room, an average of 120 million dollars is designated as unfit, every day. POV FOLLOWS THE UNFIT BILLS AS THEY ARE SEPARATED from th rest, and stacked neatly inside a CLEAR TUBE.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Between 4 and 5pm, everyday, when they’re done counting all the incoming bills, the money is shot into the shredders, where the 120 mil is destroyed.

dialogues.speaker: IS RIPPING. WE WATCH AS MILLIONS ARE SHREDDED IN SECONDS.
dialogues.text: shredded cash is spit out into a second 3 FOOT WIDE CLEAR TUBE that runs into the floor. POV JUMPS IN the tube and SUCKED DOWNWARD with the cash into-  50 51 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VAT, where a ROTATING MIXING ARM stirs the shredded cas with WET CEMENT.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The shredded money is funneled into a vat, where it’s mixed with cement, dried into bricks and dumped in the trash. 120 million turned into dust in minutes. The “liquid cash” is squeezed into an OVEN, where it is

dialogues.speaker: MOLDED INTO SQUARE BRIQUETTES, HEATED, WRAPPED AND SEALED
dialogues.text: CELLOPHANE, and spit out into a DUMPSTER.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s then picked up by the Fed’s contracted waste management, and hauled to a city dump. POV floats past the dumpster to a HULKING ORANGE GARBAGE TRUCK that pulls up. A GARBAGE MAN STEPS FROM THE TRUCK - BAS. He lowers the lifting arms, hooks the dumpster, then dumps the contents into the belly of the truck. Bas hops in the truck, and drives up a circular exit ramp POV CHASES after the trash truck, and follows it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up and out of the Fed’s exit. The Garbage Truck turns lef onto the one-way street and pulls away from us.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: If you can get in there during that 1 hour window, and get to those unfit bills before they go to the shredders, and get out clean... POV moves across the street, BETWEEN PASSING CARS, until finds Merrimen parked there. CAMERA COMES IN ON HIM, sitt behind the wheel. THE SINGLE TRACKING SHOT COMES TO AN EN

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: ...then you just got away with 120 million dollars that no one’s looking for. Donnie, Bosco, and Enson eye the Fed, and the herculean t (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 51 52 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 52.

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: Impossible. Forget once we’re inside. And getting out...How the hell do we get in? Enson motions to the front entrance to the Fed.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Not going in that way. Merrimen pulls back out into traffic, passes the front of Fed. Points to a SECOND ENTRANCE on the western side, tha BRINKS ARMORED TRUCK PULLS UP TO. 2 Fed Guards stop the t at a heavily fortified gate. MERRIMEN (CONT’D) We're going in that way. All heads turn to the Armored Truck waiting at the gate. it dawns on them... Merrimen lets the reality of what the about to attempt sink in. They drive on in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a BEET RED FACE -- Big Nick’s. Eyes bulging, che bursting with air, exhaling in spurts. Tony Z spots Nick on a free-weight bench in the office’s makeshift gym. Nick struggles with his last reps.

dialogues.speaker: TONY Z
dialogues.text: Big chest, bro, come on! Power. Power! Get pissed! Come on! Get pissed! Nick’s arms shake, gives everything to squeeze out the re

dialogues.speaker: TONY Z, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One more you crush strangé pussy tonight. Come on! You’re an animal. Nick busts up laughing. The bar collapses down on him. Practically crushes his sternum. Tony Z pulls up the bar.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Bro. You can’t make me laugh mid-set. Just frickin’ spot me next time.

dialogues.speaker: BORRACHO
dialogues.text: Ran prints through CAL ID. Got a match on the dead guy at Randy's. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 52 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 53.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They look up, Borracho stands there. They hurry into the office, hungry for details. Borracho and Gus huddle at th desks, work the phones, on the case.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Name’s Marshall Rhodes. Gun nut from Oakland. CDC Gang Unit validated him as an associate of The Brand. ATF was looking for him, trying to get him on some inter-state gun trafficking technicality. But more to the point, was stationed at 29 Palms from ‘88 to ‘92. Same time Merrimen was there.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: This is good. (motions to Borracho) Grab the book on Merrimen. Borracho pulls out the crime book on Merrimen, sets it on Nick’s desk. Nick flips thru Merrimen’s “timeline”:

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Honorably discharged in 2000. Laguna Niguel job was in ‘05. Sent up in ‘06 to USP Victorville SHU. Released from Terminal Island in Feb ‘11. October ‘11 Bicycle Club Casino gets hit. March ‘12 the stadium show. Now Brinks... (Big Nick’s mind races) ...Give me the unsolved book? Borracho pulls out the UNSOLVED OPEN CASES CRIME BOOK wit the question mark “head” on front. Nick looks thru it. BIG NICK (CONT’D) His crimey. The Samoan...Levoux. He served with Merrimen? Tony Z refers to the file on Enson they’re building.

dialogues.speaker: TONY Z
dialogues.text: In the same company. Both “FAST” Marines. Security, Close Quartered Battle Unit. Saw combat in Kosovo. Levoux also had EOD training. Got this all from the HR desk at 29 Palms.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: What did they specialize in? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 54.

dialogues.speaker: TONY Z
dialogues.text: (reading thru their files) Merrimen.... Soldiering. CQB. Levoux... EOD. Explosives.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: And the Peckerwood?

dialogues.speaker: TONY Z
dialogues.text: (reads Bosco’s file) Was Army, Corps of Engineers. And a comm guy. Impressive career, but didn’t serve together. Was the wood rep at Victorville when Merrimen was there. I’m sure that’s where they hooked up.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: (to Borracho) Run the DOT tape. Borracho plays the “DEPARTMENT OF TRAFFIC: CRENSHAW BLVD BLK” VIDEO from the morning of the Brinks heist. It’s POV from apprx. 75 meters down street. It plays on a WALL MON -- Merrimen and his crew can be seen firing on the cops. BIG NICK (CONT’D) Look the way they move, how they reload. How fast. You don’t learn that in PE. (refers to the unsolved book) Follow me here. By ‘01 they’re both out. In ‘03, we had the City National tunneling job in Hollywood. Sophisticated. Skill set. Someone with access. Unsolved. ‘04, the Dunbar Armored Car depot job. Blew the depot vault with shape charges. Sophisticated. Skill set. Someone with access. Unsolved. ‘05 in Laguna Niquel, the same. Only Merrimen gets unlucky with the tail-light. Goes to prison til ‘11. During that time, how many highly sophisticated, skilled, well executed heists do we have?

dialogues.speaker: BORRACHO
dialogues.text: Zero. You’re on a roll, keep going.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: The counter guy at the donut shop? Witness to it all. They left him. Why? Because they shoot uniforms, not unarmed civilians. Exactly what they were trained to do... (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 52 53 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 55.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (taps the unsolved crime book) We nail this crew, we solve half these cases... These are our guys. The Crew. The rest aren’t so convinced, but warming up to the idea. BIG NICK (CONT’D) Where’s Fraulein?

dialogues.speaker: BORRACHO
dialogues.text: Murph’s on him. Can move on him whenever we need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, Tony Z and Gus hustle out to their cars, when a man a suit approaches Nick. Nick eyes him warily, doesn’t recognize him. His hand starts reaching for his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Nicholas Flanagan? Nick stops, looks at him, furrows his brow, immediately suspicious. The man is OPPOSING COUNSEL, 50s. Nice watch. Briefcase. Out of shape. Looks like a lawyer. Which he is He tries to hand Nick some DOCUMENTS. Nick glares at him, braces himself as if they’re about to scrap.

dialogues.speaker: OPPOSING COUNSEL
dialogues.text: I’m your wife Debbie’s counsel. I’1l be representing her. Nick stares at the documents like they’re radioactive.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: OPPOSING COUNSEL
dialogues.text: No. I suggest you take these... (Nick still doesn’t get it) You're being served. Nick reluctantly takes the DIVORCE PAPERS. The Opposing Counsel wisely gets the hell out of there. Nick glances at the cover page, which reads "Los Angeles Superior Court. Marriage of, Petitioner: Debra Flanagan, Respondent: Nicolas Flanagan..." Nick stands there in stupefied shock. Doesn’t move. Tony and Gus walk over to him, concerned, perplexed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 53 54 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 56.

dialogues.speaker: TONY Z
dialogues.text: The hell was that? Nick vapor locks. Has never been so humiliated.

dialogues.speaker: TONY Z, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You ok, brother? Nick swallows, tries to mask it, but he’s choked up.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: .-+-guess ah...I’m getting divorced. Tony Z doesn’t know what to say. Neither does Gus.

dialogues.speaker: TONY Z
dialogues.text: I had no idea...Shit. I’m sorry. Gus looks to Tony Z, motions to give Nick his space.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Handle your business, big dog, we got you covered. Nick nods, lets them go.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Cool. All good... Fat from it, but Tony Z and Gus aren’t going to baby the None of them would have it. They get into their cars, drive off. Nick gets into his, fires up the ignition, but doesn’t go anywhere. He sits behind the wheel, engine idling, and stares ahead at nothing... INT. “PACIFIC HORIZON FREIGHT” 3PL WAREHOUSE - DAY 54 The whole crew is here, surrounding POWER GRID SCHEMATICS Written on the lower left corner of the schematics--"1200 Street. The Federal Reserve Bank, Los Angeles Branch."

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: ...there was a rolling blackout in this quadrant 4 days ago. It’s been happening all summer. They say they’ve got full backup power, but actually, they don’t. They go into a “brownout”, where they start prioritizing the grid, and the priority is on the vault. All security measures in there stay intact. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 57. 54

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But anything else that sucks a lot of power, like motion in the hallways and out rooms, and the banknote shredders in the count rooms, shut down. They rely on the mantraps and the manual locks for security. To time this during another rolling blackout is going to be impossible. So we have to simulate it. (looks to Bosco) Can we cut in and force them to go brown for about 2 minutes? Bosco thinks it over. Can’t make a promise here that you can’t keep. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: BOSCO
dialogues.text: I’d say yes, but I’d rather have a test run to be sure.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: As long as we don’t risk exposure.

dialogues.speaker: BOSCO
dialogues.text: That won’t be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Once we’ve breached the count room, that will take care of everything but the cameras. They’re unaffected by the brownout. They run on their own batteries. The solve is, the room’s lit by a bay of fluorescents. When one of the tubes gets punctured, it causes all of them to flicker. Because the cameras run at 30 frames, that flicker, the wavelength of it, ruins the image. Can’t see fuck all.

dialogues.speaker: BOSCO
dialogues.text: Where'd you get all this information?

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: You don’t have to worry about that. Just trust me when I say it’s solid. Merrimen pauses a second. Doesn’t like being questioned.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are you with the Verizon hook?

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: I'll have him in a couple of days. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 54 55 56 57 58 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 58.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Merrimen nods. Refers to ENLARGEMENTS OF THE PHOTOS BOSCO TOOK OF THE REGULATORS at the donut shop crime scene.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Know your enemy. Major Crimes, LASD... Keep an eye out, constantly alter your routine, don’t do any stupid shit. They all look to one another, then get to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A 70's Chinese restaurant. Red booths, lobsters suffocati in murky tanks, god-awful banquet lighting. Donnie’s at t bar talking with the owner, a 50 year old Chinese woman w doesn’t take any shit, COU-CHI.

dialogues.speaker: COU-CHI
dialogues.text: .«..yu pay own gas. I pay yu twee dolla po delibewee. An yu keep tip. Yu stat Wendday. Eleben o’clock... That's pretty much it. Donnie nods “okay”. INT. DONNIE’S CAR - DAY 56 Donnie winds through the unincorporated industrial city o Vernon, FOLLOWING AN ORANGE WASTE MANAGEMENT TRUCK. He ke a loose tail, TAKES NOTE of the surrounding areas, WRITIN DOWN the names of every street, notating every turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bas controls a series of levers at the side of the truck. entire LOAD OF TRASH dumps out onto the ground. Finished, hops in the truck, drives off. A figure scurries through the sea of grazed garbage. Donn He digs through the fresh pile of refuse. The wretched sm makes him gag. Finds what he’s looking for. The CELLOPHAN WRAPPED BRICKS OF SHREDDED CASH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merrimen pops a fresh clip into his Sig Sauer, presents h weapon down range. Fires rounds. Steady, rhythmic shots. Bosco is in the adjacent lane position, shooting rounds. Merrimen empties his clip. As he reloads, out of the corn of his eye, he notices a man enter, set up in the lane position one to his left. Merrimen glances over. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 58 59 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 59.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It’s Nick. Loading clips. Into a Glock. Merrimen stiffens Nick looks up, makes brief eye contact with him. Merrimen looks down range, then grins to himself. He and both start firing. Trying to one up the other with each s Merrimen stops after 5 rounds. Nick keeps going. 15, clip done. As Nick reloads, the range falls quiet for a moment The quiet is shattered as Merrimen tears off rapid-fire rounds. Empties the clip, drops it out, pops in fresh one and fires. BAMM BAMM BAMM BAMM. So fast it sounds like he got it on full auto. Clip done, drops it, pops it, fires. Rinse and repeat. He burns through 4 clips in 14 seconds. Nick doesn’t move. No one else in the range does. Merrime packs up his guns and ammo, gives Bosco a look, and they leave. STAY ON NICK -- watching Merrimen go. He can’t help himself. Goes to Merrimen’s lane position, toggles the target lever, and slowly the target motors back to him. Target returns, comes to a stop. Nick checks it. Only 4 o 5 mark the bull's-eye. But 40 to 50 struck center mass. Merrimen can shoot. Nick nods to himself. Sighs deeply, then returns to his l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enson and his family finish a service, spill out onto the surrounding streets with hundreds of other parishioners. Enson impatiently tries to gather his family to the car, kids running around all over.

dialogues.speaker: HE SPOTS HIS DAUGHTER, MALOA, LEANING INTO A LOWERED, BLO
dialogues.text: RED SUV. A deep hip-hop bass rumbles from within the hood ride. She talks to it’s passenger, ROLANDO, 17. Good-look tough, cocky, Blood gangster. A father’s worst nightmare. Enson squints his eyes, barks:

dialogues.speaker: MALOA
dialogues.text: Maloa bristles, cuts her conversation off. Enson gives he glare, which his kids know all too well. She quickly fall back in line with the family. As the SUV slowly rolls out, Enson mad-dogs Rolando. Rola leans back in his seat, throws his arm out the window, an gives Enson an arrogant nod. Enson stands there, eyes loc onto the SUV, and grinds his jaw. A voice startles him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 59 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 60.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: I feel you, brother. Enson turns. It’s Gus. With his wife and kids, all dresse Sunday’s best. They don’t know each other. But they do.

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (motions to the departed suv) That's trouble right there. Gotta keep an eye out for that one. Enson nods, checks Gus out. Plays it cool.

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: Yeah, believe that. Gus waves to him, heads off with his family. Enson furrow his brow, puts on his sunglasses, then goes to his who wa by his truck. As Enson hits “unlock”, he glares at Maloa.

dialogues.speaker: ENSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He Piru? Thinks he’s tough, huh?

dialogues.speaker: MALOA
dialogues.text: Dad, no! I already told mom, he’s like the most popular guy in 12th grade. And he’s all-CIF in football. He’s going to “scl

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: Yeah yeah. To rob somebody? Maloa’s eyes water and her face goes red. She’s in a fury fueled by young love.

dialogues.speaker: MALOA
dialogues.text: Dad, no he’s not!! He’s so nice!! (turns to her mom) Mom, see! I told you dad would -

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: - THAT’S ENOUGH! Maloa jumps into the back of the car and slams her door s tries to stop the tears that cascade from her adolescent eyes. Malia looks to her husband, he to her, as they get

dialogues.speaker: ENSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know about this? Malia raises her eyebrows and sighs, long and deep. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 59 60 61 62 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 61.

dialogues.speaker: MALIA
dialogues.text: You seriously wonder why she likes a boy like that? Enson turns to his wife, furrows his brow. MALIA (CONT’D) Look in the mirror. That stung. Enson broods, doesn’t like that at all. Turns over the engine, then grows quiet. Because he knows it’s true... INT. MERRIMEN’S SUBURBAN - DAY 60 Same vantage point of The Fed. Merrimen and Enson are par down-street, look through BINOCS. Enson keys a TWO-WAY RA The SOUNDS of RADIO-SPEAK come through clearly. IT’S THE FED'S SECURITY CHANNEL. THEY’RE TAPPED IN.

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: (into Nextel) Greenpeace, this is Lava. Keyed in up top. How’s it below?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beneath the streets, Bosco, in DWP GEAR, is at work on an entanglement of wires and power lines.

dialogues.speaker: BOSCO
dialogues.text: (into nextel) This is Greenpeace, good to go below.

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: (over nextel) Copy that. Lights out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The slightest flicker in the bay of lights overhead. Foll by a series of lights lighting up on the control board. SECRET SERVICE GUARDS #1 AND #2, JOHNNY and CAM, quickly a series of checks on the security control board.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (into walkie-talkie) Back up power’s up.... ON MERRIMEN AND ENSON -- the voices of the Fed’s security guards come in over the two-way: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 62 63 64 65 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 62.

dialogues.speaker: FED CHATTER
dialogues.text: (over radio) We've gone brown. Lock all man-traps manually, over... Roger that. Exterior cameras are up. Count rooms on stand- by. Merrimen and Enson share a look. Enson speaks into the nextel:

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: This is Lava. They’ve gone brown. Nice job. ON BOSCO -- hurriedly undoes all of his equipment, then c his hands together. EXT. DOWNTOWN LA —- DAY 63 QUICK CUTS of DONNIE ON THE JOB, DELIVERING “DIN TAI FUNG CHINESE to several different OFFICE-BUILDINGS. PULL BACK to REVEAL BIG NICK, surveilling Donnie from afa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AL, a BRINKS SECRETARY dials. The other end picks up:

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE TELEPHONE VOICE
dialogues.text: Federal Reserve, accounts receiving.

dialogues.speaker: BRINKS SECRETARY AL
dialogues.text: Hey, it’s Al with Brinks... POV JUMPS INTO THE PHONE’S MOUTH-PIECE, RACES ALONG SUBTERRANEAN TELEPHONE WIRES, TO AN EXCHANGE BOX... EXT. RAMPART STREETS —- DAY 65 MACK is spliced into the OPEN EXCHANGE BOX, connected to VERIZON TEST PHONE. He listens in on the conversation:

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: .-+.we have a drop for City National we need to schedule. How’s Wednesday at 2? Mack looks down at the LCD DISPLAY. Both the SOURCE and RECEIVING PHONE NUMBERS pop up on the LCD. Mack cuts out of the tapped call. He dials the Fed with t test phone -- BRINKS SOURCE NUMBER READING AS HIS OWN. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 65 66 67 68 69 70 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 63.

dialogues.speaker: MALE TELEPHONE VOICE
dialogues.text: Federal Reserve, accounts receiving.

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: Hey, Al with Brinks again. I forgot to schedule a drop for Bank of America. What do you have open today?

dialogues.speaker: MALE TELEPHONE VOICE
dialogues.text: We could take you at 3. Does that work? Mack pauses for a second, then hangs up. Keys his nextel:

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: Lava, this is Ghetto Bird. We’re good to go on the drop, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie walks in, Fed ID CARD clipped to his DIN TAI FUNG shirt pocket, a plastic DIN TAI FUNG TAKE-OUT BAG in each hand. He says hello to Secret Service Guards #1 and #2. T search the bags. Donnie passes through the man-trap, come out the other end. They hand him the take-out bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie steps into the MEN’S BATHROOM. INT. MEN’S BATHROOM - DAY 68 Donnie enters, steps into a stall, quickly stands on the toilet seat, reaches up, and PUSHES OPEN AN AIRVENT.

dialogues.speaker: HE PLACES ONE OF THE TAKE-OUT BAGS IN THE VENTILATION SHA
dialogues.text: ABOVE, lowers the vent back down. Slips out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie collects cash from Luigi, Junior, an overweight bl woman, DORIS, and several other Fed employees who all sit around, bullshitting, digging into the Chinese-food-carto Donnie stuffs the cash in his pocket and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick, Gus, Borracho, Murph and Tony Z pow-wow.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: .-..what if it’s part of his regular route? Feds gotta eat too. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 70 71 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 64.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Delivering Chinese to the Fed? My left nut that’s part of his route. They’re casing it from the inside. Go back. Besides cash, what else did they lift from the Casino and rave?

dialogues.speaker: BORRACHO
dialogues.text: Fed Deposit slips. But those were probably in with the cash -

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: - or, not. Maybe they took the cash to disguise the fact that they were really there for something else. Then they take down an armored car that’s empty?! Come on. Remember what Donnie said. “They're trading up.” They’re going big.

dialogues.speaker: MURPH
dialogues.text: Nick. You can’t take down the Fed. Sorry. Merrimen’s no dummy. It’s impossible.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: The Fed is the Olympics, and Merrimen’s fuckin’ Carl Lewis. I’m telling you... Fraulein’s holding out on us. He knows.

dialogues.speaker: TONY Z
dialogues.text: ...then let’s stir things up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merrimen, Enson, Bosco, Donnie, and Mack, sit at one of t teppanyaki tables hunched over Kirins and steak. None of pay much attention to the TEPPANYAKI CHEF’S routine. Holl and some of her GIRLFRIENDS from Chatsworth are there, engaged in their own conversation. Something catches Donnie’s eye. He looks past Merrimen, a almost has a seizure. BIG NICK AND THE REGULATORS WALK IN SIT AT THE SUSHI BAR. Donnie tenses. Drunk SUSHI CHEFS carry-on behind the bar, hollering Japanese obscenities at women who saunter by, play it off charm. Big Nick gets up, WALKS RIGHT PAST THEIR TABLE. Donnie do his best not to be noticed. Everyone eats quietly. Nick walks back by, sits. Merrimen takes note of the big with the goatee. Donnie shifts, when a VOICE calls to him (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 71 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 65.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy. Donnie reluctantly looks. Big Nick is staring right at hi BIG NICK (CONT’D) Donnie, right? Merrimen and the others bristle. Big Nick walks over, rea to shake Donnie’s hand. Really? BIG NICK (CONT’D) From the gym. I spotted you the other day. Donnie’s shakes his hand, feigns ignorance.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: ...oh, right, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: (nods to the others) What’s up fellas? (points to Merrimen) You play football at Long Beach Poly? You look familiar. He did, but Merrimen shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Not from around here.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: (to Donnie) What’re you doing here? Work near here?

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: Ah, no...just grabbing dinner.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Really? Food here sucks. Donnie doesn’t know how to respond. Nick checks out the girls. HE AND HOLLY’S EYES MEET. He gives her a thorough undressing. It’s not lost on Merrimen. BIG NICK (CONT’D) We come here for the ass. Pause. Merrimen’s doing everything he can to keep it cool The situation could not be more uncomfortable. Donnie tri to bring an end to it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 71 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 66.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: Right on, man. See you at the gym.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Definitely. Nick hovers for a second, then finally shoves off. But he can’t help himself. He turns back to Merrimen. BIG NICK (CONT’D) Number 55. That’s how I remember you. We wore the same number, bro. 55, right? Merrimen looks up at Nick for the first time. Just stares him. Says nothing. But his eyes say everything. BIG NICK (CONT’D) I went to South Torrance. We played you twice. Remember all those fat-ass Samoans you had? They’re big, but man, lazy motherfuckers. Slow-twitch muscle fibers. No explosiveness. All that Spam, I guess... We crushed you guys. Enson simmers. The tension is becoming unbearable. The Co look over. Nick’s pushing it too far. Merrimen stands.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Don’t appreciate you poppin’ off, bro. And stop perving on our women.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Hey, no need to get all agro. I’m sorry. Am I being rude? (to Donnie) Was I rude?

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: - Just get the fuck out of here. Nick gives Merrimen a thumbs-up.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Kunpai! (looks to Holly) Have a good night, ladies. Nick takes his seat at the sushi bar. No one knows what to say or do. Instead, they all just ea Merrimen broods. He and Enson share a look, speak unspoke words. Merrimen’s eyes drift to Donnie, who sits hunched his food, and burn into the back of his head.  72 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 67. INT. MERRIMEN’S SUBURBAN, SOUTH BAY - NIGHT 72 Merrimen drives. Donnie rides shotgun. Enson in back righ behind Donnie. They drive through vast South Bay industri streets in silence, past refineries and defense contracto Donnie stares straight ahead, battling cold waves of fear Finally turns to Merrimen.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: Where we going? No answer. Then Merrimen gently brakes, and turns into a desolate parking lot at the rear of a sprawling, Tudor-st house with well manicured lawns. A sign out front reads, “MCKAY'S SOUTH BAY MORTUARY”. Merrimen parks, shuts off the engine. Dread grips Donnie. They sit there in the quiet. The only sound heard is a fa hollow, furnace-like drone emanating from the mortuary. A rear door to the mortuary opens, and a BESPECTACLED MAN a dark suit appears, looks in their direction. Merrimen flashes his brights twice. With that, the man subtly nods and disappears back inside, the door left ajar. Merrimen turns to Donnie, looks at him. Donnie’s mind ree

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: You a cop?

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: What?! You kidding?! ...Fuck no! Merrimen just stares at him, finally looks away, nodding. Merrimen remains calm and collected. Yet he exudes, as always, an energy of unpredictable lethality.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: ...-you wearing a wire? Donnie sighs, shakes his head. Musters up the courage to back at Merrimen.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: No... Are you? Long pause. Merrimen grinds his jaw, debates.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Get out of the car.  73 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merrimen walks toward the rear door of the mortuary. Donn reluctantly follows. Enson trails Donnie a few feet behin Merrimen stops just before the door, faces Donnie. The so of the sound reveals itself -- behind the door, is a CREMATORIUM. It’s furnace burns eerily hot. Donnie starts to tremble with fear.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Strip.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: Where'd you hide the wire?

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: What goddamn wire?! I’m not wearing -

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: - take your fucken clothes off! Donnie begins to visibly shake. Pulls his shirt off, his pants down. Stands there in his underwear like an asshole Enson rifles through his clothes. Looks in his underwear. Finds nothing. Tells Donnie to put his clothes back on. Donnie pulls on his jeans, when Enson buries a fist deep Donnie’s unsuspecting gut. Donnie collapses to the ground gasping. Enson kicks him several times. Donnie balls up. Enson stops. Merrimen yanks Donnie to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Open your mouth. Donnie does as told. Merrimen jams a Sig-Sauer down his throat. Donnie’s eyes water. His chest heaves. His eyes plead.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How does he know you? And don’t tell me from the gym.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: (voice gagging) I swear, I don’t know -

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: - smoke him. Smoke the punk. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 73 74 75 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 69.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Donnie shakes his head vigorously. Merrimen pulls out the gun. Donnie gulps in air, quivering violently.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: I’m not a cop. I swear to you...he came to me he knows who you are but I didn’t tell him a thing I swear to fuckin’ God. It was a while ago, right when we first hooked up. He sweated me, haven’t seen him since, thought he’d leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: What do they know?

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: Nothing. I didn’t know back then anyway. If we have to call it off, I get it. Merrimen stares at Donnie for what seems like an eternity deciding. He finally sticks the gun back in his waistband Merrimen wraps on the mortuary door once, then he and Ens start walking back toward the truck.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Put your clothes on... (opens truck door. To Donnie) ...Friday. Confirm with him it’s on. Make sure he’s on the line... Donnie meets Merrimen’s gaze, and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick drives slowly past the upscale homes of Rolling Hill Estates, searching for something. Spots DEBBIE’S CAR park in front of a Mediterranean McMansion, along with a few others. Landscape lighting is on. Looks like a party is underway. Nick parks a ways down the block, eyeballs the house. Get out, walks toward it. He’s pretty buzzed. Slight chance a neighbor will call the cops on him. This is not his hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick lets himself in. About 6 kids, ages 3-13, are going apeshit in the living area, all refereed poorly by an overworked Salvadoran nanny. Nick’s daughters are amongst them. Cassady sees her dad and gasps with joy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 70.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Peanut, give me a hug! She runs to him, grabs onto his leg:

dialogues.speaker: CASSADY
dialogues.text: Daddy!!! Just around the corner in the chef’s kitchen, the adults’ enjoying a red wine dinner stiffen, as they recognize the voice. Debbie is there, on a double-date with her older sister SANDEE, South African pro golfer-type brother-in-l RUUD, and her “DATE”, one of Ruud’s boys. Debbie cranes her neck to see into the entryway, when she almost faints. Her jaw drops as she mouths, “oh my God.” And then he appears. History’s most uninvited guest. A position that, at least in this instance, he relishes. Ni stands in the middle of the kitchen, nodding hello to the all. He sways a bit, reeks of saké. Debbie’s mouth still hangs agape, she just wants to disappear. They all do. Th date looks like he’s about to puke.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: What’s for dinner? (no response) ...relax! I already ate. Nick reaches into his blazer, pulls out rolled up paperwo from the small of his back. The divorce docs. Everyone’s widen when they realize Nick is packing his Glock. Nick goes to their table, drops the docs down, looks to R BIG NICK (CONT’D) You gotta pen, stud? Ruud reluctantly stands, does his best Kofi Annan:

dialogues.speaker: RUUD
dialogues.text: Nick, bru, I was gonna call you. Lets you and I go to dinner next week and- As Ruud rests a hand on Nick’s shoulder, Nick reflexively swats it away. Hard. His veins bulge, swell with volatili

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Just get me a pen. Ruud swallows, grows nervous, goes to find a pen. Nick lo to Debbie’s Date. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 71.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How’s the wine? Date’s lips contort and tremble as he tries to speak, can Date starts to back away from the table. Nick holds his h up and shakes his head. Uh-uh. Date freezes, not going anywhere. Ruud hands Nick a pen. Nick flips thru the docs, starts arbitrarily signing pages.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So where do I sign, anywhere I guess, right? (he keeps signing pages) And I imagine it’s assumed that, you know. (eyeballs Date) ...if you were to ever touch my girls, or say, talk to them? Or even look at them? That ah...you know. I go boom boom. Know what I’m saying? But that’s self evident, right? No reason to have that in writing. Nick finishes signing the docs. Turns to Date, who looks he’s about to cry, and punches him in the shoulder. BIG NICK (CONT’D) It’s all good buddy! Come here, give me a hug. We’1l save a fortune in therapy. Nick hugs the Date, all smiles. Sandee looks to her husba Ruud, her eyes demanding he do something. While Debbie’s shock and trepidation have simply turned to disgust.

dialogues.speaker: DEBBIE
dialogues.text: Always such a spectacle with you.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Pretty much, yeah. Ruud finally grows a pair, steps to Nick.

dialogues.speaker: RUUD
dialogues.text: Nick, come on -—

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: - Call the cops. Nick glares at him, defiant. Ruud holds his ground this t

dialogues.speaker: RUUD
dialogues.text: Time to go, mate. I’m sorry. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 76 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 72.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nick stands there a while. Then finally, he turns, walks But he can’t help it. He barges back in, looks at Date.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: When you're hittin’ it from behind, and you're wondering what that thing is on her ass? That’s a tattoo. Of my name. Just a heads up. Satisfied at last, Nick leaves. INT. ENSON’S HOUSE - DAY 76 Malia finishes touching up Maloa’s make up. Maloa wears h prom dress, about to burst with anticipation. Her sibling run around the house, excitement in the air. Except for d Enson paces in the living room like a caged animal. A limo pulls up outside. Rolando gets out, struts up to t house. He’s rocking a Beckham-esque mohawk, and a rented tux with old school Air Jordans. Siblings scream out, “he here!” STAY ON ENSON -- pacing. Maloa and her mom greet Rolando the door. They exchange greetings and giggle nervously. Rolando looks Maloa up and down, and whistles.

dialogues.speaker: ROLANDO
dialogues.text: Damn girl, you look fine! Enson gulps in air, then walks over to them. Maloa grows anxious, introduces them:

dialogues.speaker: MALOA
dialogues.text: Rolando, this is my dad.

dialogues.speaker: ROLANDO
dialogues.text: ‘Sup Mr. Levoux, nice to meet you! Enson says nothing, just nods, eyeballing the kid. Roland reaches his hand out to street-shake Enson, but Enson doe return the favor, extending his for a proper handshake instead. A bit of an awkward moment as Rolando corrects himself. Enson looks to Maloa and his wife.

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: Gonna borrow him for a sec, yeah? (to Rolando) Come here, brah. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 76 77 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 73.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Enson walks off. Rolando reluctantly follows. Maloa dies 1000 deaths as her dad and date disappear into the garage INT. ENSON’S GARAGE - DAY 77 As Rolando steps into the garage, he gasps. Standing ther facing him, are Merrimen, Bosco, and Enson’s Samoan Mafia brothers. Tatted-up, swoll, and dripping with sweat from their workout. All color suddenly drains from Rolando’s f

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: So here’s whassup, brah. For the past 15 years, my little girl’s safety and protection, has been my responsibility, and my responsibility alone. Now, for the first time in her life, I gotta pass the baton. I gotta hand over that responsibility... to you. Enson glares at Rolando, long and hard. Behind him, Merrimen, Bosco, and the Samoan Mafia do the same.

dialogues.speaker: ENSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t fuck up. Or your mother will weep her eyes out, every day the rest of your life, when she has to feed you, wipe your ass, and push you around in your wheelchair. Rolando wets himself. He nods emphatically, starts stuttering.

dialogues.speaker: ROLANDO
dialogues.text: Yes-s-s-s-sir. Enson pats Rolando on the back.

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: See you at 1130. Rolando slowly turns, and walks out. HOLD ON ENSON AND THE BOYS. Enson looks to them, as if to say, “So, how was 1?”

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: I’m pretty sure he got the point. They all bust up, laugh their asses off.  78 79 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick sits alone at his desk, his eyes gaunt and hollow, studying “MERRIMEN’S CREW” CRIME BOOK, comparing it with “Unsolved?” crime book. Looks over CRIME SCENE PHOTOS of “City National Hollywood ‘03” tunneling job, the “Dunbar Armored Depot ‘04” vault shape-charge job, etc... He studies DONNIE’S FILE. It’s woefully thin -- copies of IMSA racing license, now infamous moving violations, and SMALL ARTICLE from the Ventura County Star newspaper detailing local kid Donnie Alison taking second at the 19 National Spelling Bee competition. A QUOTE from the artic claims Donnie has a “near photographic memory."

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Why’s Fraulein’s file so thin? Gus works at his desk, tired and hungry.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: We can’t find a damn thing on him. Nick furrows his brow. Forages through Merrimen’s Cali De of Corrections file, discovers that Merrimen’s cellie at Terminal Island was none other than WILLIAM “Willy Lump L PUMP, the most prolific bank robber in the history of the state.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Merrimen’s cellie at TI was Willy Lump Lump.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: No shit? (Nick nods “no shit”) How did we miss that?!

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Because we're not very good at our job. Gus frowns. Nick brings MERRIMEN’S MUGSHOT up on his comp screen. Merrimen’s eyes stare right at Nick. Piercing, intense, direct. Not an ounce of bullshit in those eyes. a ton of menace. Nick meets Merrimen’s gaze, and stares b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gentlemen's club. The weekday crowd is pretty thin. But t DJ works the mic like it’s Saturday night in Vegas. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 80 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 75.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WE WATCH IN KUBRICKIAN POV as a dancer comes out on stage grabs the pole, and does her seductive thing. A HAND COME INTO FRAME, DROPS A $20 ON STAGE. She nears us. IT’S HOLL She looks right down at us, starts to strip and writhe. Crawls toward us. Licks her lips then grabs the $20. Thru her ass out and stuffs it in her micro-bikini. REVEAL the big-tipper is BIG NICK. He sits stage-side, su in his chair, the King of the Jungle. He grins, all lust vice. His eyes lock onto his prey. INT. NICK’S TRUCK, TORRANCE - DAY 80 Nick’s parked in the lot of a TACO STAND, eating. Murph a Gus are in back, doing the same. Donnie walks up, hops in shotgun. Nick offers him a taco. declines, launches into Nick:

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: What the fuck was that all about?! You “spotted me at the gym”?!

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Tranquillo. They’re not gonna off you when they know there’s heat...When’s the party?

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: ...Friday.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Friday’s all I can tell you.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: You're protecting me on this.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Fraulein, don’t worry about a thing. Donnie scoffs, gets out, shuts the door. Looks back.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: (taps the door) Better wear your vests.  81 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 76. INT. “PACIFIC HORIZON FREIGHT” 3PL WAREHOUSE - DAY 81 Merrimen and Enson sit in their warehouse office with HUG BANDI, 63, Croatian, board-member of the Longshoreman Uni olive oil and Ouzo importer, and “criminal receiver”. Whi translates to Street as FENCE. Hugo is on his cell, having a CODED CONVERSATION that pin pongs between Slavic, English and Spanish. Looks to Merri

dialogues.text: ..-you’re at Container Terminal 114... (listens to the other end) Maersk Sealand, operated by Maersk Line Liberia. You are all cleared on the passenger manifest as crew. Hugo finishes his conversation, hangs up. Slides 5 ENVELO to Merrimen. One for each man.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO BANDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Travel documents, itineraries, which are all different. Everyone takes separate routes after your ride on the supertanker. Groups attract attention.

dialogues.speaker: OK
dialogues.text: Merrimen nods, looks inside his envelope. The ITINERARY - “,..Ensenada...Mexico City...Havana.” Flips open his BRASILIAN PASSPORT. Already stamped with VISAS and CUSTOM STAMPS from various countries. HUGO BANDI (CONT’D) Passports are stamped with visas, customs, so you don’t look like a new traveler. That raises flags...You meet in Havana, where my people will handle the financials. Relax there, buy some girls, and get a tan so you don’t look so American. Merrimen looks over his “cover” -- BUSINESS CARDS and PAPERWORK support his new Brasilian identity.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO BANDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Business cards, papers, all support your cover. Merrimen hands Hugo a thick envelope. They shake hands. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81 82 83 84 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 77.

dialogues.speaker: HUGO BANDI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And no sweats or sneakers or baseball hats. In the rest of the world, only mafiosi dress that way. Suits only...

dialogues.text: Merrimen walks past the complex pool, approaches an apartment. He carries a Samsonite suitcase. Unlocks the door, enters. INT. HOLLY’S APARTMENT - DAY 83 Moment Merrimen walks in, A WOMAN GASPS. He braces himsel rounds into the living room. Freezes. Holly's there, naked on the couch. She darts into a bedro And standing in the middle of the room in all his glory, Big Nick. He’s shirtless, pulls on his jeans. Porn plays mute on the TV. Nick and Merrimen just stand there, staring at each other Nicks’s eyes go to his GUN, resting on the couch 15 feet away. Merrimen follows his gaze, sees it. He’s closer to gun. And Nick knows it. Their eyes meet again. Nick raises his eyebrows, motions Merrimen to go for it. He doesn’t. Merrimen walks past th couch, past Nick, and into the bedroom. Then shuts the do Nick stands there. Tries to listen in on them. Can’t hear anything. He pulls his clothes on, grabs his gun, and lea INT. HOLLY’S BEDROOM - DAY 84 Holly pulls on underwear. Merrimen watches, then steps to her, threat in his aspect. Corners her. She cowers.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: But I did what you told me.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: How was it? His breathe bathes her. She starts to tremble, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: HOLLY
dialogues.text: Baby, please... Disgust and jealousy course through him. He fights the ur forces himself to turn away from her.  85 86 87 88 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 78. INT. dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit. INT. HOLLY’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 86 Merrimen sits in a Lazy-boy in front of the TV, brooding. talks quietly to himself while cleaning his various firea which rest in pieces at his feet. He can’t shake the subt faint ticking sound in his head. Eventually, his eyes drift to the empty couch, and the er WATCH that rests there. Merrimen glares at it, unblinking The ticking grows louder. INT. DONNIE’S APARTMENT - DAWN 87 ECU of a digital watch. 5:14 am. A beeping alarm sounds. finger comes into frame, shuts it off. Donnie gets up, already dressed. His apartment has been stripped clean, packed up. He goes to the large window, o it. Sounds of the city drift in. He looks at something. A blocks down the street, is... THE FEDERAL RESERVE BANK. Beyond it, dawn’s first light gives form to downtown's skyline. INT. ENSON’S HOUSE - DAWN 88 Enson cooks eggs and sausage links for his kids, amidst t wonderful chaos of family getting ready for the day. Malo comes in late, rushed, makes herself toast.

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: Got practice this morning? You need protein. Enson puts a plate of eggs in front of her. She doesn’t e it, doesn’t make eye contact either. Mad at her dad. Enso shakes his head, takes the plate away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 88 89 90 91 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 79.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A car honks outside. Maloa pops up, grabs her backpack. C get out of here fast enough. As she bolts for the door:

dialogues.speaker: ENSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maloa. She stops, looks back. Enson motions her over. She reluctantly comes back to him.

dialogues.speaker: ENSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have fun? Maloa shrugs. Enson struggles to find the words.

dialogues.speaker: ENSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He treat you nice? Finally, Maloa looks up at her father. She nods with certainty. Enson has a tough time digesting the fact that his baby girl has fallen in love. But such is life. Enson nods, then he hugs his daughter. And she him. He squeezes her tight.

dialogues.speaker: ENSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love ya. The car honks again. She’s gotta go. Maloa smiles at her tears in her eyes, then she runs out to the car. Enson watches her go, a little girl no more. INT. HOLLY’S APARTMENT - DAWN 89 Merrimen sits on the edge of the bed, watching Holly slee Not wanting to wake her, he quietly stands, slips out. In the living room, he loads his firearms into their case His eyes go to the watch again. He listens to it tick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merrimen walks past the complex pool, Samsonite and gun-c in hand. His wary eyes subtly sweep the surrounding area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick drives up, parks, hops out, approaches a school yard packed with grade school kids playing during morning rece A fence surrounds the entire playground, no way to get in Nick stands at the fence, searches the crowd for his girl Spots McKenna. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 91 92 93 94 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 80.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He wraps his fingers around the fence, is about to call o to her, then hesitates. She plays happily, he doesn’t wan to interrupt. Instead, he just watches her play. INT. NICK’S F-150 TRUCK - MORNING 92 Nick climbs in his truck, parked across from the school. pops in the keys, turns on the ignition. Is about to driv off, when he pauses. He sits there, suddenly becoming very still, staring into space... And then he breaks down. Tears pour from his eye His chest heaves as he sobs, crying for the first time th he can remember, and harder then he probably ever has... Slowly, Nick pulls himself together, and drives off. INT. HOLLY’S APARTMENT - MORNING 93 Holly stirs in her bed. Her eyes flutter open. She sits u looks next to her where Ray usually is. But he’s not ther She touches his pillow. It’s cold. Her eyebrows furrow. S gets up, looks in the bathroom, then closet where his thi are. Nothing there. She goes to the living room, nothing still. She brings a to her mouth, and shakes her head as her eyes water. Any that Ray Merrimen was ever there, has vanished. INT. “PACIFIC HORIZON FREIGHT” 3PL WAREHOUSE - MORNING 94 Merrimen, Bosco, and Enson load M4 mags, conduct function checks on all firearms, pull on tactical plate carriers. Donnie enters, is surprised to see them “jocking up”. He looks around, perplexed. Armored Truck is gone.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: Change in plans. (motions to a set of BDUs) Jock up. Donnie can’t hide his apprehension. Looks to Bosco for an explanation, doesn’t get one. Bosco instead double-stacks M4 mags. Donnie reluctantly pulls on the gear. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: 94 95 96 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 81.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED

dialogues.speaker: ENSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...if anything’s off, I’m out... Understand, bro? Merrimen meets his gaze, and Enson doesn’t like what he s Merrimen’s eyes are distant, cold. Too cold.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Nothing’1l be off. Merrimen turns away, goes back to loading gear. HOLD ON ENSON, watching his crimey. Closely. Wary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick walks in, is immediately met with the sounds of cops prepping for battle. Tony Z, Gus, Borracho, and Murph pul ballistic vests, function check shotguns and carbines, lo Sig P226s. No one says much. They all focus, do their bes keep the pucker-factor at a minimum. Because all know, instinctively, two tribes are going to war. Tony Z picks up his Benelli 12-gauge, Glock-17. Looks Nic over, knows all is not well. And they can’t afford that today.

dialogues.speaker: TONY Z
dialogues.text: You good? Nick meets Tony’s gaze. After a moment, Nick hardens, the nods. He’s good. Satisfied, Tony heads for the trucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merrimen drives, his eyes glued to the rearview, constant checking their six. Around him, magazines are being loade Enson hands Donnie a SUPPRESSED HK-416, with a double-sta magazine protruding. Enson indicates the safety, the trig

dialogues.text: She's good to go. First, (points to the gun triggerwell) ..-keep your index finger out of the triggerwell until you have to shoot someone. When we get out of the truck, thumb the safety down once here, (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: 96 97 98 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 82.

dialogues.speaker: ENSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (points to the safety) .--for 3-round burst. If shit gets hairy and one of us tells you to go full-auto, thumb it down once more, squeeze the trigger and hold ‘til you run dry. Enson depresses the magazine release button releasing the double-stacked mag. He then slides the other mag into the magazinewell and firmly slaps it home.

dialogues.speaker: ENSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tug it, make sure it’s in nice and good. Hit this bolt release and you’re ready for round 2. Otherwise, aim at the floor. Donnie nods. Merrimen rounds a corner, pulls into a BANK AMERICA PARKING LOT. Signage reads, “Montebello Towne Center.” Donnie tenses. Enson hands Donnie a C420 GAS MASK. Donnie follows suit, pulls it on. ENSON FIRES A THREE-ROUND BURST INT THE CEILING. MOMENTARY CHAOS SETS IN. People gasp, some h the floor. A baby cries. A useless SECURITY GUARD stands frozen in indecision. Merrimen rushes him, HK416 in his face.

ENSON BLASTS THE CAMERAS in the corners, SHUTS OFF THE OVERHEAD LIGHTS MERRIMEN SHUTS ALL THE BLINDS. Motions for Donnie to help him. THEY BARRICADE THE DOORS -- pushing desks in front o them. Bosco zip-ties the customers, tellers, bank manager. Merr looks around, whistles. THE BANK HAS BEEN SECURED. Donnie breathes so hard, his mask starts to fog up. Enson Donnie cover the room, as Bosco pulls the bank manager to feet, drags him to his DESK. Merrimen hovers over him. The gas mask distorts his voice has a surreal, nightmarish effect. The MANAGER shakes.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take a deep breath, then write this down. The Bank Manager's trembling hands search the desk for a and paper. Finds them. Then he takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know you already triggered the silent alarms. So I want you to pick up the phone, call into Parker, and explain the following. Within 1 hour, they have to deliver 10 million dollars in unmarked, small denomination bills to this bank, inside a Department helicopter, topped off with fuel. And supply us with a pilot... (Bank Manager takes it all down ) Explain we have hostages, and will kill one every hour, until our demands are met. We will also kill a hostage for every cop car that comes within sight of here. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: 98 99 100 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 84.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Further explain that if they even attempt to have a negotiator contact us, we will automatically kill another hostage. Is that clear? (Bank Manager nods) Pick up the phone.

dialogues.text: - relax. I know. Just open it.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: - you are.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN

dialogues.speaker: VOICE

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: - you just killed a hostage. CLICK. Merrimen cuts out. End of conversation. Merrimen l to Bosco. Bosco grabs a LATINA, 30ish, drags her across t room. She’s terrified, quivers:

dialogues.text: No no no, what are you doing?! Bosco drags her into the bathroom. The room falls silent. that is heard are HER WHIMPERS AND PLEAS. Dread in the ai

dialogues.text: Son of a bitch. Nick, Tony Z, Borracho walk up shaking their heads.

dialogues.text: What the hell you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: You were running surveillance, and let this shit go down?!!

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: No! We were first on scene, relax!

dialogues.text: You're so full of shit, Flanagan. You just got somebody killed!

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: You heard the demands, you stupid motherfucker! You put a fucking negotiator on?!!! The two sides are about to brawl. BIG NICK (CONT’D) Fuckin’ jarheads. Nice haircuts -

dialogues.speaker: LAPD COPS TONY Z / BORRACHO
dialogues.text: Fuck you! Fuck you! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: They’re already on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of the HOSTAGES shake with fear. Donnie, Bosco and En cover the room. The PHONE rings. The Bank Manager answers

dialogues.speaker: LAPD NEGOTIATOR
dialogues.text: This is the Los Angeles Police Department. I will now be your contact. You can call me Tim. Is this the man in charge? Merrimen glares at the Bank Manager. Sweat runs down his face.

dialogues.speaker: BANK MANAGER
dialogues.text: This is the branch manager. I’m speaking on the man in charge’s behalf.

dialogues.speaker: LAPD NEGOTIATOR
dialogues.text: Do you have a name, branch manager - The Bank Manager speaks urgently as he looks at Merrimen.

dialogues.speaker: BANK MANAGER
dialogues.text: - listen. They’ve already killed one of the hostages. A woman. They will not speak to you again. If you call back again before their demands are met, they will kill another. Just send what they want! ON THE LAPD NEGOTIATOR -- looks to Lobbin' Bob.

dialogues.speaker: LAPD NEGOTIATOR
dialogues.text: How long’s it gonna take?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: We haven't tracked down a Helo quite yet. And right now, they’re telling me, we only have about 6 million in petty cash.

dialogues.speaker: LAPD NEGOTIATOR
dialogues.text: Mix in bunk bills to cover it.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (nods) ...buy us 2 hours. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: 103 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 88.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ON THE BANK MANAGER AND MERRIMEN -- staring at the phone.

dialogues.speaker: LAPD NEGOTIATOR
dialogues.text: ...the money and the helicopter are en route. But, please, please understand, this takes a while. You need to be patient. You need to give us 90 minutes. Bank Manager looks to Merrimen. Merrimen nods.

dialogues.text: ...okay. Don’t call back, or another hostage dies. Merrimen hangs up, duct-tapes the Bank Manager’s mouth. E tosses Merrimen a flour sack. He pulls it over the Bank Manager’s head. Enson and Donnie DUCT-TAPE ALL OF THE HOSTAGES MOUTHS, pull WHITE FLOUR SACKS OVER THEIR HEADS. Hostages start whimpering, muttering prayers, think they’ going to die. The crew goes to the vault. Except for Merrimen. He pulls a cell-phone, dials. Walks to the window, looks outside. ON BIG NICK -- at the squad car. He, Lobbin' Bob and LAPD study SCHEMATICS OF THE BANK spread out over the hood. Nick’s cell vibrates. He checks the number, squints his e doesn’t recognize it.

Nick steps away, answers.

dialogues.text: (over cell) Watching? The voice makes Nick freeze. He slowly turns to face the bank.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: ...yep... How the hell you gonna get out of this one? ON MERRIMEN -- staring through the blinds at Nick, distan visible through the traffic down the street. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 89.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Not sure yet.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: (over cell) .«..you get my number from her cell? Merrimen plays it very cool. Just watches Nick. ON BIG NICK -- staring at the bank, and his enemy.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: I’m not cuffing up. Nick weighs his response to the threat made clear.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: That’s all right. I didn’t bring my cuffs anyway... Long pause on the other end. Nick’s eyes are locked onto bank. Then:

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: I can see that. Click. Merrimen hands up. COME IN TIGHT ON NICK. He clenc his jaw, salivates, mind racing. Tony Z walks up.

dialogues.text: Was that who I think it was?

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Yup. IN THE VAULT -- Enson and Bosco feverishly prep the shape charge. Merrimen enters, checks his watch. 2:14. CAMERA FLOATS back into the bank, past the bound and gagg hostages, into the BATHROOM, where the Latina lies. No bl anywhere. COME IN TIGHT ON HER -- her breaths can be seen against the flour sack. SHE’S ALIVE. AT THE LAPD SQUAD CAR -- Suddenly a thunderous THUMP ratt the street. The GROUND SHAKES BENEATH THEIR FEET. Telepho poles sway. CAR ALARMS go off.

dialogues.text: They just blew the safe. IN THE VAULT -- Smoke billows. MERRIMEN’S POV -- looking a GAPING HOLE. NOT IN THE SAFE. IN THE VAULT FLOOR. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 90.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: ...they didn’t blow a safe. He looks to Tony Z, Gus, Borracho. They don’t disagree. Something here is very, very off. Nick turns to Lobbin’ B

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (motions to the bank) Like they’re going somewhere!? Relax! Nick seethes. He looks to his crew, they to him. Suddenly, Nick walks off, toward his truck. Reaches behin his seat, pulls out a TIRE-IRON, slams the door shut. He through traffic, and runs straight toward the bank. ON TONY Z, GUS, BORRACHO, LOBBIN’ BOB and LAPD -- cogniza now of what Nick is doing. Tony Z, Gus can’t help but lau

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Gotta be shitting me.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Is he off his meds?! TELL HIM TO GET THE

dialogues.speaker: FUCK BACK
