dialogues.text: 103 104 105 106 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 91.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Peers inside. SEES HOSTAGES ON THE FLOOR, BUT NO SIGN OF GUYS. Pushes on the door, feels that it’s barricaded. Ste back, SWINGS THE TIRE-IRON INTO THE GLASS DOORS, SHATTERI THEM. ON TONY Z, GUS, BORRACHO, MURPH -- racing to back their partner up. They present their weapons, cut across the street. ON BIG NICK -- climbing through the window, weapon drawn. He sweeps the room, passes over the bound hostages, heads back toward the vault. His heart pounds in his ears and h eyes widen as he moves through the smoky air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick enters. Looks down, and sees it -- THE GAPING HOLE B IN THE FLOOR. A SEWER-LINE is barely visible below. ON THE REGULATORS AND LAPD -- breaching into the bank, weapons drawn. IN THE VAULT -- LAPD enters. NO SIGN OF ANYONE. LAPD Cop shines his flashlight into the gaping hole. And there stands Big Nick. Down below in the sewer. He looks

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Got a flashlight?

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, ENSON, DONNIE AND BOSCO EMERGE FROM A MANHOLE O
dialogues.text: A NEARBY STREET in a quiet neighborhood. Parked right the the BRINKS ARMORED TRUCK. The commotion outside of the bank can be seen BLOCKS AWAY They mount the truck, start pulling off their clothes for wardrobe change. Doors shut. Merrimen guns it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Nick stands at a sewer “intersection”, part of the endless SUBTERRANEAN LABYRINTH beneath our city streets. shines the flashlight down the various routes. 40 meters behind, LAPD and SWAT inspect the hole left in the vault. Tony Z and Gus approach Nick. Both realize, the suspects long gone. Which direction they fled is a pure guessing g

dialogues.speaker: TONY Z
dialogues.text: Christ... Where does it all lead to? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 106 107 108 109 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 92.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: Where doesn’t it? Nick turns to face them, a wry look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: You know what this whole thing is? .--It’s a decoy... It’s a fucking decoy. They all look to one another, come to the same conclusion

dialogues.speaker: TONY Z
dialogues.text: ...The Fed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've slipped into new outfits -- Merrimen and Enson in BRINKS UNIFORMS, Donnie into his DIN TAI FUNG DELIVERY CLOTHES, Bosco into DWP GEAR.

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: (into nextel radio) Ghetto Bird, this is Lava. We confirmed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mack stands by a street level OPEN EXCHANGE BOX, his equipment taped in. He speaks into his secured nextel:

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: Check. Appointment’s 2:45. Got 2 minutes. And that Chinese better be some cold ass food. They ordered an hour ago, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merrimen pulls to the side of the road. Bosco hops out wi his DWP gear. Merrimen’s Suburban is parked there. They drive off. RUN A FINAL CHECK of the MONEY TUBS’ CONTENTS. Cash is bundled, secured. Check the BofA Deposi Slips, Donnie’s supplies -- over-sized ZIP-LOCK BAGS, HAI GEL.

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: (into shoulder-fitted nextel) Peckerwood, all set? Donnie can hear Enson in the EAR-PIECE buried in his ear. Donnie gives Enson a thumbs up, takes a deep breath. Enso pulls the top off one of the money tubs.  110 111 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 93. EXT. BANK OF AMERICA —- DAY 110 Big Nick and his boys exit the bank, breeze past Lobbin’ and the LAPD, who comb over the Econoline Van. Lobbin’ Bo shakes his head to himself as Nick passes.

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: You need professional help.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Desperately... (shoulder taps Bob as he blows past) My bad last time. Your crime scene. Nick salutes Bob with a solidarity fist pump. Bob holds h hands up in surrender, unsure where the hell Nick is goin Nick, Tony Z, and Gus mount their vehicle, leave the scen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merrimen and Enson pull up to the security gate at The Fe The Receiving Guard, JACKSON, black, 62, leans out from t bulletproof SECURITY BOOTH, doesn’t recognize them. New g

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: Got you on a new route? Merrimen hands Jackson a SCHEDULED DROP CONFIRMATION.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, they switched us over this week. Jackson picks up a PHONE. Speaks into it:

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: Got a 3 o’clock for BofA? Jackson waits for the confirm, inspects the “Scheduled Dr Confirmation”. He looks over Merrimen, glances inside the truck. RECEIVING GUARD#3 steps out from the booth, holdin POLE with a MIRROR ATTACHED to the end of it. Runs it alo the bottom-side of the truck, inspects the underbelly.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: If it’s a problem, we can have base reschedule.

dialogues.speaker: JACKSON
dialogues.text: It takes a sec...While we’re waiting, could I bother you for your ID's? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 111 112 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 94.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Merrimen hands Jackson their BRINKS IDS. Jackson looks th over. Merrimen shifts a little. What’s taking so damn lon Jackson listens in the phone, hangs up. Jackson hands Merrimen their IDs, waves them through as the GATES FINAL RISE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merrimen guides the truck along a WINDING CIRCULAR DRIVEW that leads 5 stories down. They approach the RECEIVING DO Receiving Guard#2, MONROE, guides them into the dock. Merrimen and Enson hop out. Open the rear doors of the tr wheel out MONEY TUBS, “FRB-LA” emblazoned on all.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: B of A, 2.2? (Merrimen nods) Sign here. Merrimen signs the RECEIVING CONFIRMATION FORM. As he doe Monroe eyeballs him. Looks at his ID.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You new, Marc?

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Yes sir. Monroe nods, glances at his watch, annoyed. This is one t watch out for. He’s suspicious by nature. Fastidious.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: You're late.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, we got caught up in traffic. Merrimen smiles. Monroe doesn’t.

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: I don’t know where they had you guys routed before, but we run a tight, tight ship here. If you’re going to be late, have base call in. You should know that.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: I know, I know. Traffic was -

dialogues.speaker: MONROE
dialogues.text: - just have them call. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 112 113 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 95.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Monroe grabs the clipboard. Moves off. Enson and Merrimen wheel the MONEY TUBS to the RECEIVING BAY. Behind the wal 3” thick bulletproof plexiglass are the count rooms, bust with activity. Most employees look like they’ve been pluc from the Universal City Walk. Minorities with iPods in th ears, or fat white women and old white dudes with ponytai Merrimen eyes the omnipresent cameras above. LUIGI and JU approach, laughing about something, moving through a seri of man-traps. Luigi nods to them, motions for Merrimen to pass the B OF A FEDERAL RESERVE DEPOSIT SLIP through a SL Merrimen does. Luigi reads it, shouts through the glass:

dialogues.speaker: LUIGI
dialogues.text: Hundreds?! (Merrimen nods) We're a little backed up. Be about 45ish! Merrimen gives him a thumbs-up. Enson pushes the money tu into a MAN-TRAP CHUTE. Shuts his side. Opposite side then opens. Luigi and Junior punch the tubs through the man-tr into the 100 dollar count room. MERRIMEN’S POV -- of the banknote machine. In the CLEAR TUBING, A HUGE STACK OF HUNDREDS WAITS TO BE SHREDDED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merrimen’s BofA tubs are in line, about 4 back. Luigi and Junior run bundles of 100’s through the counting machine. stack of UNFIT 100s grows further. Junior blasts Power 10 COME IN ON the LAST BofA MONEY TUB. DISSOLVE through its plastic exterior, and MORPH inside -- DONNIE RESTS IN THE

dialogues.speaker: BUNDLES, SWEAT POURING FROM HIS BODY.
dialogues.text: He struggles to take LONG, SLOW, DEEP, QUIET BREATHS. He whispers into a NEXTEL MIC hidden beneath his shirt:

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: Repeat Offender, this Peckerwood. I’m in. ON MERRIMEN -- hears the message over nextel. Looks aroun No sign of Monroe.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: (quietly) Greenpeace, this is Repeat Offender. Peckerwood is in, over.  114 115 116 117 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bosco speaks back into his nextel:

dialogues.speaker: BOSCO
dialogues.text: Roger that, Repeat Offender. Lights out. He engages a series of controls on the grid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cam checks the security control board, shakes his head. Shouts through the bulletproof glass to Johnny:

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: We're brown again! Gotta shut down. Pull’em out of the count rooms! Johnny nods, speaks into a secured radio, as Cam checks t SURVEILLANCE SCREENS. COME IN ON MONITOR 14 -- the count room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON MERRIMEN’S EAR. An EARPIECE inside. Locked into internal radio wavelength. Overhears Johnny:

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: (in earpiece) .-..we’re going brown. Gotta shut down for a bit. All teams go ahead and take 10.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: (quietly into nextel) Get ready to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luigi shuts down the counting machine. He and Junior punc out of the man-trap, step into the hallway, lock the door Quiet inside now. Just the sounds of Power 106. ON MERRIMEN -- through several walls of man-trap glass, h sees Junior and Luigi LEAVE THE COUNT ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: (into nextel) You're clear. ON DONNIE -- crammed inside the tub. Very, very slowly op the top lid. He looks to the FLUORESCENT LIGHT PANEL 10’ above. He extends a thin, RIGGED CAR ANTENNA, inches it o extending it upward. 2 feet further. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 117 118 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 97.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ON MERRIMEN -- he and Enson feign interest in the LA Time Merrimen’s eyes furtively glance around -- MERRIMEN CAN M OUT THE ANTENNA. All the FED EMPLOYEES head for the cafeteria. ON DONNIE -- couple of inches further. ON CAM -- in the security nerve center, reading a mag instead of looking at monitor 14, where the antenna is barely visible. ON DONNIE -- lightly jerking the antenna up, into the fluorescent bulb. Jabbing it. Can’t break it. ON MERRIMEN -- 2 Employees walk right past the 100 bankno count room. Merrimen and Enson tense. The employees disap into the cafeteria. ON DONNIE -- jerks it again. POP. A small shower of glass The BULB goes dark, causing the entire BAY OF FLUORESCENT FLICKER slightly. Donnie quickly inches down the antenna.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: (into mic) Am I clear? ON MERRIMEN -- sees the lights flickering. Scans the area

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: (whispers into nextel) Clear. Go. Go. ON CAM -- still reading. MONITOR 14 GOES DIM. WHITE NOISE ON DONNIE -- slides the top open further. Looks around. H shit. He’s here. Fed Employees walk past, down the hallwa He lowers to the ground, crawls over to the count machine the CLEAR TUBE, just above the shredding compartment. His eyes widen as he takes in the sight -- piles and pile 100 dollar notes. TENS OF MILLIONS OF DOLLARS. From underneath his shirt, he slides out the OVERSIZED ZI LOCK BAGS. Clicks open an undercarriage of the tubing, reaches in, and STARTS SHOVING MONEY INTO THE ZIP-LOCKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Nick tears through city streets. Gus white-knuckles i while riding shotgun. Tony Z in back. Nick keys the radio (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 118 119 120 121 122 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 98.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: (into radio) We'll take north south streets, Fig and Grand. You take east west, 6th and 8th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murph drives, haul’s ass. Borracho rides shotgun, on the radio:

dialogues.speaker: BORRACHO
dialogues.text: (into radio) We got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fed Employees watch TV, munch on shit from vending machin DORIS, the fat black girl with long candy-stripe fingerna checks her watch. Her “buddy” SHARON is upset:

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: What’s taking them so goddamn long?

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: Need to lose weight anyway, honey. Sharon dials a company phone. Other end answers:

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE
dialogues.text: (thick Chinese accent) Din Tai Fong.

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: It’s Sharon, at the Fed. We ordered almost an hour and a half ago. I only have so much time for a lunch break -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mack, on the VERIZON test phone, does his best Chinaman:

dialogues.speaker: MACK
dialogues.text: - es coming. Be dare in a few meenute. Sharon huffs. She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie works as fast as he can, rifling cash into zip-loc

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: (over earpiece) They just called for the Chinese. Hurry. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 99.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Donnie fills another bag, seals it, circumvents the shredders, and stuffs it into the CHUTE that leads into t floor. The zip-lock bag slides downward out of sight. CAMERA FOLLOWS THE ZIP-LOCK -- filled with MILLIONS OF UNSHREDDED DOLLARS, as it splashes into the vat, where th mixing arm stirs the bag into the wet cement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny enters. Notices Monitor 14 is on the fritz.
Cam looks. Taps the screen. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is motion out in there?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: Yeah. We’re still brown.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Better override, turn it on. ON DONNIE -- shoveling bags down the chute, when he notic RED BEAM on his arm. He freezes. ON CAM -- a light flashes on monitor 14, and an alarm sou

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (into secured radio) Luigi, you there? ON LUIGI -- in the cafeteria. Clips the radio off his bel

dialogues.speaker: LUIGI
dialogues.text: (into radio) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (over radio) Check the 100 count. Motion just went off. ON MERRIMEN -- having over heard it all. He looks to Enso

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Step on them. Quick. Enson reaches in his pocket, presses down on a secured ra “talk” button. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 123 124 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 100.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whispers into nextel) Get out now. You set it off. Get out. ON DONNIE -- shuts the shredding tube. Scurries behind th counting machine, to an AIR VENT IN THE FLOOR. Starts unscrewing the screws holding it down. ON LUIGI -- hits “talk” to speak, but gets cut off by STA coming from the radio. ON CAM -- hits “talk” on his radio.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (into radio) Luigi, you - But all he gets is LOUD STATIC AND WHISTLES.

dialogues.speaker: CAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into radio) Damnit. Luigi, you’re steppin’ on me. Nothing but feedback. He slams the radio.

dialogues.speaker: CAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s going on here today?! (to Johnny) Somebody's steppin’ on the goddamn radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cam enters, shouts to Luigi.

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: You gotta let go of the talk button. You're steppin’ on the line!

dialogues.speaker: LUIGI
dialogues.text: (holds up his radio) It’s not me. We back on yet?

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: No. Check the 100 count please. Motion went off. Switch to line 5. ON LUIGI and JUNIOR -- walking toward the count room. ON DONNIE -- frantic. Fumbling with the SCREWS. One left.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: (over ear-mic) They're right there. 15 seconds. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 124 125 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 101.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ON LUIGI and JUNIOR -- approaching the man-trap. ON DONNIE -- unscrews the last one. Lifts up the vent. ON LUIGI and JUNIOR -- punching in their codes. ON MERRIMEN and ENSON -- about to explode. Enson looks to right. Monroe’s looking at him. Enson looks away. ON LUIGI and JUNIOR -- man-trap clicks open. They enter, search the room. Luigi peeks behind the counting machine. Nothing back here. Just wires, outlets, dust, and the air vents. Luigi punches the radio -- all static. He remembers, switches to line 5:

dialogues.speaker: LUIGI
dialogues.text: (into radio) This is Luigi. Nothing here. ON MERRIMEN -—

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: (into nextel) Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie, squeezed inside of the AIR-DUCTS, COOL AIR- CONDITIONED WIND BLASTING past him. His heart pounding.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: (into mic) In the vents. ON MERRIMEN -- all he hears is wind-blown static.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: (into nextel) Say again? (there’s no answer) --.shit. ON LUIGI -- Cam’s voice comes over his radio:

dialogues.speaker: CAM
dialogues.text: (over Luigi’s radio) I‘ll juice up the room. Run the count, make sure it’s on. Power returns to the counting machine. Luigi and Junior continue their job of feeding the cash into the machine. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 125 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 102.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Luigi waves to Merrimen and Enson, gets their attention, mouths and motions to them, “give us 20 minutes.” ON MERRIMEN and ENSON -- waving back, “no problem.”

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: (into Nextel) Greenpeace. You’re done. Cut out.

dialogues.speaker: BOSCO
dialogues.text: Roger that, cutting out. Bosco hurriedly cuts out, pulling wires, resetting the po He packs up his gear and rushes toward the exit. ON JUNIOR -- opening Merrimen’s BofA tubs. First one, ful Second one, full. Third one -- only a dozen bundles lying haphazardly on the bottom of the tub.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: They put like 10 bundles in this tub. Luigi looks back, furrows his brow, then shrugs. He turns the shredders. COME IN ON the remaining 100 dollar notes the clear exit tube, as they are sucked into the shredder ON DONNIE -- in the ventilation shaft. Almost pitch black here. Light creeps in through the air vents. He crawls as fast and quietly as he can, air blowing in his face. Comes to a VENTILATION-SYSTEM INTERSECTION. Pulls a SMALL NOTE from his pocket WRITTEN ON A HOFBRAU BAR NAPKIN -- a HAND-DRAWN MAP OF THE VENTILATION-SYSTEM, with a RED-LINE designating his route. It POINTS UP. Donnie looks up. 12 above is an opening to another shaft. ON LUIGI and JUNIOR -- finishing the count. Luigi checks counter on the machine -- a number visible in red LED.

dialogues.speaker: LUIGI
dialogues.text: What’s the total?

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR
dialogues.text: Seven twelve, two one four. The LED counter reads -- 712,214. Luigi grabs the radio.

dialogues.speaker: LUIGI
dialogues.text: (into radio) The count is on. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 125 126 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 103.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ON MERRIMEN -- watches as Junior and Luigi head their way through the man-traps toward him. ON DONNIE -- climbing up, feet and hands pressed into the sides of the shaft. Exhausting, slow, isometric movement. Donnie’s muscles quiver. He reaches for the vent opening, almost losing his grip, SLIPS, GRABS ON WITH HIS FINGERTI One final heave, he pulls himself into the upper ventilat shaft. Cringes in pain, his fingers throbbing. He wedges himself in. Light spills up from a vent 20’ ahead. Looks his map. X marks the spot, right over that vent. He start wiggle forward, GETS STUCK. It’s too narrow. ON MERRIMEN -- Luigi returns the DEPOSIT RECEIPTS and TUB

dialogues.speaker: LUIGI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (shouts through the glass) Why’d you only have like 10 bundles in the last tub?

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry?

dialogues.speaker: LUIGI
dialogues.text: The third tub. It was practically empty.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: ...That’s the way we got’em.

dialogues.speaker: LUIGI
dialogues.text: Next time you have anything less than 20 bundles, just put them in a cash sack. A lot easier.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Sorry about that. Just learning the ropes. Luigi nods. Merrimen waves bye politely, moves for the tr DONNIE -- stuck in the shaft. He’s pulled his shirt off, is rubbing HAIR-GEL all over the shaft’s walls. He extend his arms forward, starts dragging himself through the sha It works. He squeezes toward the opening ahead, the tight of the shaft’s walls pressing on his chest, causing him t gasp in short breaths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barreling ahead. Downtown skyline can be seen.  127 128 129 130 131 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie drags himself to the vent. Next to the vent, in th shaft, IS THE PLASTIC DIN TAI FUNG TAKE-OUT BAG. DONNIE’S POV -- just below is the MEN’S BATHROOM. He’s directly above one of the three toilet stalls. The bathroom’s empty. Donnie takes a deep breath, then pulls the vent. HE DROPS THE CHINESE TAKE-OUT ONTO THE MIDDLE STALL FLOOR. Stall#2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merrimen drives, winding up the circular driveway. Jackso raises the gates, waves “bye” to Merrimen and Enson. Merr smiles, gives Jackson a two-finger salute. INT. THE FED, MEN’S BATHROOM — DAY 129 Donnie lowers himself down, WHEN THE BATHROOM DOOR OPENS. quickly pulls his legs back up. Holds his breath. It’s Johnny. He moves for Stall#1. Sits on the toilet, groans. If he were to look up, he’d see a sweaty bare-che man hovering over him in the vent, covered in pink hair-g But he doesn’t. He’s enjoying his quiet time. Johnny fini up, flushes, and leaves. Donnie goes for it, quickly HOPS DOWN INTO THE STALL. He pulls his shirt back on. Tries to wipe the gel off of his arms with toilet paper. Flushes it down. He comes out of the stall. Checks himself in the mirror. Wipes sweat from his forehead. Calms himself. This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Armored Truck pulls up next to Merrimen’s Suburban, parked roadside. Bosco’s at the wheel. Bosco follows Merr as they pull out into the streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doris and Sharon pay Donnie.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: -..one of the guys didn’t come into work. They had me doing all the deliveries.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I'd tip you honey, but that just took too damn long. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 131 132 133 134 135 136 137 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 105.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Doris winks at Donnie. Donnie nods sheepishly, leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The WASTE DISPOSAL GUYS toss the MONEY BRICKS into the DUMPSTER. COME IN ON ONE OF THE BRICKS -- a corner of one of the zi locks protrudes an inch out of the brick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie moves toward the elevator, passes the JANITOR. Gla at him. The Janitor is WOLFGANG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie, tension racking his body, can’t stop fidgeting, sweating. The elevator doors open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doris and Sharon, opening all the little take-out boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HULKING ORANGE WASTE MANAGEMENT TRUCK beep-beeps as i backs up to the dumpsters. ALEXI hops out, lowers the lif arms, and unloads the dumpster into the belly of his truc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donnie approaches the EXIT MAN-TRAP. The man-trap opens. Donnie enters, waves nicely to the SECRET SERVICE GUARD o front. Looks at the red light, waits for it to turn green ON THE SECRET SERVICE GUARD -- checking the SIGN-IN SHEET DOESN'T SEE DONNIE’S NAME. Furrows his brow. ON DORIS and SHARON-- digging into the food, taking famis bites. Sharon stops chewing. Spits the food out into a napkin. Looks up at Doris in disgust. Doris shrugs:

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: What? Damn you’re finicky. DONNIE -- waiting in the man-trap. Eyeing the light. Stil red. SECRET SERVICE GUARD -- flipping through the sign-in shee Looking for Donnie’s name. Confused. GLARES AT DONNIE. SHARON -- she’s on her cell-phone, pissed off. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 137 138 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 106.

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: I wait almost 2 hours and when it finally comes it’s cold?! What kind of bullshit - COU-CHI’S VOICE - ma’am! Ma’am. I sorry. I got no oder fom you today. No oder. You never call.

dialogues.speaker: SHARON
dialogues.text: We never called?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secret Service Guard still stares at Donnie, when the PHO his desk starts ringing. Finally, he hits the man-trap bu ON DONNIE -- light turns GREEN, and the man-trap opens.

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE GUARD
dialogues.text: Sorry to keep you waiting buddy, but ah... The phone at his security desk continues to ring. SECRET SERVICE GUARD (CONT’D) I don’t have you signed in. I just stared my shift, but, I don’t see your name. Shows Donnie the sign-in sheet. Sure enough, his name isn there. THE PHONE IS STILL RINGING. THE GUARD REACHES FOR

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: I thought I signed in with what’s his name? The guy on the last shift. Secret Service Guard debates. Looks at Donnie. He carries nothing. Screw it. The phone still rings. Has to answer t

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICE GUARD
dialogues.text: Forget it. Have a good one, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: All right, you too. Donnie heads for the front doors, quickens his pace as th Guard answers the phone. COME IN ON SECRET SERVICE GUARD as he answers. Sharon can heard on the other end, shouting something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON DONNIE -- hustling away from the Fed, looks back over shoulder, tries not to break out into a sprint. Rounds a corner, spots a VERIZON VAN parked there. Heads for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON CAM, JOHNNY, SECRET SERVICE GUARD -- searching the str for Donnie, AS THE ORANGE WASTE MANAGEMENT TRUCK PASSES B CAMERA FOLLOWS the Orange truck as it heads south on Gran A BLOCK AHEAD, ARMORED TRUCK AND MERRIMEN’S SUBURBAN MERG INTO TRAFFIC, AND FOLLOW IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON NICK, GUS and TONY Z -- desperately searching the down streets for their suspects. Gus and Tony Z share a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MERRIMEN -- tailing the Orange truck, doing his best t negotiate the heavy Friday traffic. The Suburban is ahead holding a tighter tail. Merrimen can’t keep up.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: (into nextel) Stay tight stay tight! I’m stuck. Tries to change lanes. Someone behind honks, blocks him i

dialogues.text: ON BOSCO -- behind the wheel, 3 car lengths back. The Ora truck approaches a traffic light. It turns yellow. The Or truck accelerates, blows the light. Bosco swerves into an open lane. Still yellow. He guns it. It turns red. Sees a MOTORCYCLE COP. Cringes as he blows the red. Bosco looks back. Motorcycle cop bangs a left, didn’t not Bosco sighs, looks ahead -- the Orange truck turns right blocks ahead. Bosco punches it. Bangs a right.

dialogues.speaker: BOSCO
dialogues.text: (into nextel) Go right on Gage! Right on Gage!  144 145 146 147 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Orange waste management Truck turns down a small side street, nears the VERNON CITY DUMP. Crosses an alley that intersects the street. THE ARMORED TRUCK EMERGES FROM THE ALLEY, CUTS THE ORANGE TRUCK OFF. The Orange Truck’s brakes lock up. Squeal to a halt. Behi the Suburban SANDWICHES THE ORANGE TRUCK IN. Bosco jumps from the Suburban, HK in hand. Runs up to the Orange truck’s cab, points the HK inside.

dialogues.speaker: GET OUT
dialogues.text: The Driver takes one step out, when Bosco BRINGS THE BUTT THE HK ACROSS HIS SKULL. The driver collapses in a ball. Bosco jumps into the truck’s cab, Enson into the Suburban All 3 vehicles tear away from the scene. COME IN ON THE WASTE MANAGEMENT DRIVER, grimacing in pain Only it isn’t Alexi. IT’S BAS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON DONNIE -- nearing the Verizon Van. Mack appears next t it, meets eyes with Donnie. Then Mack suddenly backs up. Donnie spins. A VEHICLE ALMOST RUNS HIM OFF THE ROAD, sla to a stop. Donnie jumps to avoid getting hit. Doors open. Donnie is grabbed, tossed in. Abducted in seconds. Mack turns away, plays it off as if uninvolved. The vehic takes off. Nick’s F-150. EXT. “PACIFIC AUTO SCRAP & SALVAGE”, SOUTH GATE - DAY 146 A sprawling, neglected junk yard. Scraped cars stacked 5 high. The Armored Truck pulls into the yard, the Suburban Orange Truck right behind it. They all come to a stop. SAMOAN MAFIA, Enson’s bros, receive the Armored Truck. Merrimen jumps out of the Armored, retrieves his gear. En nods to his Samoan boys. THEY IMMEDIATELY START TO STRIP- THE ARMORED TRUCK, make it disappear.

dialogues.text: Tony Z roughs Donnie up in back. Nick looks at their captive. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 147 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 109.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Donnie’s scared, confused, can’t believe he got burned. N has had it. He lets go of the wheel, lurches back at Donn attacks him, pounds his face.

dialogues.text: Nick tears at Donnie’s shirt, and in the process RIPS THE AND A NEXTEL TRANSMITTER FROM DONNIE’S WAIST. Nick looks it briefly. Then throws it out the window. ON MERRIMEN -- loading gear into the Suburban, when he he the commotion over the nextel. He strains to hear more closely, but the line goes dead. ON NICK’S TRUCK -- Donnie is curled into a defensive ball Blood pours from his mouth. Tony Z cuffs Donnie’s right h to the door handle, jams a gun into gut.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: Pacific Salvage. Junk yard in South Gate. Donnie looks to them. They to him, making sure this is so

dialogues.text: (into radio) Pacific Auto Scrap and Salvage. Alameda Corridor, South Gate... ON MERRIMEN -- Nextel suddenly crackles in Merrimen’s ear

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN

dialogues.speaker: MACK, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: (over radio) .+.suspects there now. We’re 5 minutes out. Borracho pulls it up on their GPS. Murph keys their siren They slice through and past traffic. EXT. “PACIFIC AUTO SCRAP & SALVAGE”, SOUTH GATE - DAY 149 Frantic, focused activity as the Orange Truck is wiped do striped of any incriminating evidence. Enson throws all o the Brinks gear in a BARREL. Pours lighter fluid all over clothes, LIGHTS THE BARREL AFLAME. Bosco engages the dump-truck’s controls. The rear of the truck rises and opens, ALL OF ITS CONTENTS SPILLING OUT.

dialogues.text: MONEY BRICKS. They quickly drag them to the Suburban, thr them in back. Slam the rear doors. Merrimen fires up the Suburban’s engine. Enson looks to h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Semis, Big Rigs, and rush hour traffic pack the main arte into the Port of Los Angeles. The Suburban pushes through aggressively best it can.

dialogues.text: Tension thick as their progress is slowed further by gridlock. Enson checks his watch. Merrimen’s eyes bounce and forth between the road ahead and the rear-view mirror Bosco passes out their travel docs and passenger manifest Traffic grinds down to complete stop. Merrimen’s eyes are pinned to the rear-view. Bosco starts to peel off his arm

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Keep your vest on. Bosco stops. He and Enson look to Merrimen.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: About 30, 40 cars back...Look. Enson tenses, follows Merrimen’s gaze, looks back. ENSON’ POV -- through the exhaust and congestion behind them, bu in deep traffic, is a vehicle we recognize. NICK’S F-150. Both Enson and Bosco turn, strain to get a cleaner view.

dialogues.speaker: BOSCO
dialogues.text: Is it?!

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: (to Bosco) Give me that. Enson motions to one of the HK-416s. Bosco hands it over. Enson raises it, looks through the gun’s sight at the F-1

dialogues.speaker: ENSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON BIG NICK -- eyes locked on the Suburban ahead. Their visual is occasionally blocked by Semis. Gus and Tony Z tighten their vests, check their mags, flip safety off. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 152 153 154 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 112.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: (into radio) Be advised, they’re wearing full body armor. No center mass shots. Aim for limbs and vitals only.

dialogues.speaker: BORRACHO
dialogues.text: (over radio) 10-4. The gridlock reaches them. They grind to a halt.

dialogues.text: Murph edges the car into the far right emergency lane, overtakes a chunk of traffic. Gets a visual on the Suburb

dialogues.speaker: BORRACHO
dialogues.text: (into radio) Coming up on suspects’ 4 o’clock! Move on suspects from their rear! Borracho gets a clean view of the Suburban 3 lanes over a just ahead. Taps Murph’s arm:

dialogues.speaker: BORRACHO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here here here! Murph throws it into park. They grab carbines and extra m

dialogues.text: Enson and Bosco’s heads are on a swivel, search the traff behind for incoming threat. Enson spots something, what l like movement between cars -- COPS GETTING OUT OF THE F-1 He slams his fist into the dash in frustration. Merrimen grabs Enson by the arm, hard.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Hey! Enson slaps Merrimen’s hand away, turns melancholy.

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: What did I tell you? What did I tell you?!! Merrimen glares at him, then raises his eyebrows, questio his manhood. All said without words. Merrimen motions to adjacent neighborhood, and the myriad ways to flee.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Go ahead... I’m not ditching. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 154 155 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 113.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Enson’s eyes burn hot. He doesn’t blink, doesn’t take his eyes off of his lifelong teammate, and crimey. Then, his glaze over, as resignation sets in. Enson turns to Bosco:

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: Give me the 48. Bosco passes Enson the 7.62cal MK48 machine-gun. Enson cl on the MK48 ammo box, opens the feed-tray and chambers th link, slams it closed, and yanks the charging handle to t rear of the gun. Ready for war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PUSHES LOW AND STEADY thru the traffic toward the Suburban. ONE BY ONE, NICK AND THE COPS MOVE INTO FRAME, crouched low, using the vehicles as cover. They signal on another, spread out into different lanes, approach the Suburban. ON MERRIMEN -- a break in the traffic. Vehicles ahead beg to slowly, painfully move. Merrimen urges them on. ON BIG NICK -- eyes wide as he closes in. He signals to motorists as he passes them, quietly orders them to:

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Stay down, down!! Behind your engines! ON BORRACHO -- coming at the Suburban from it’s 4 o-clock Sees the break in traffic ahead, quickens his pace. Motio for citizens to “Stay Down!” He brings up his carbine, aims sights at the Suburban’s passenger door, when the door bursts open.

dialogues.speaker: POLICE
dialogues.text: Enson opts to step out, massively clad in head to toe bod armor, the MK48 in hand. It’s a terrifying sight.

dialogues.speaker: CHEST. ENSON TURNS ON BORRACHO AND OPENS FIRE ON FULL AUT
dialogues.text: Flames spew from the gun’s muzzle as BULLETS RIDDLE BORRA CUT HIM DOWN where he stands. The gunfire so loud, rapid powerful, it sounds like the air is tearing. A MAELSTROM OF GUNFIRE EXPLODES ALL AROUND as Nick and th cops open fire on Enson and the Suburban from various positions. Rounds puncture the Suburban in clusters, shat windows. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 155 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 114.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Various shrieks of terror and panic from the motorists. H blare as some cars attempt to push through the hotzone.

dialogues.speaker: BOSCO JUMPS OUT THE DRIVER SIDE AND RETURNS FIRE ON THE C
dialogues.text: dropping to a kneeling position to increase accuracy. ON BIG NICK AND THE COPS -- taking cover from Bosco’s fir ON DONNIE -- still cuffed in the truck, tugging frantical at the door handle, trying to free himself. ON BOSCO -- signaling Merrimen:

dialogues.speaker: MOVE
dialogues.text: With Bosco’s cover-fire, MERRIMEN SLIPS OUT AND DASHES FO THE SURROUNDING NEIGHBORHOOD and side street.

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: (shouts to Bosco)

dialogues.speaker: PEEL OFF
dialogues.text: Bosco peels off, bounds behind and past Enson as Enson la down awesome fire. The cacophony is deafening. ON BOSCO -- as Bosco comes to Merrimen’s position, he tap Merrimen’s shoulder as he passes. With that, Merrimen pop and opens fire with HK416.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: (shouts to Enson) tll Enson now bounds past Merrimen, as they perform A DEFENSI PEEL to perfection. The rate of fire and it’s sound, is rhythmic. And to the trained ear, beautiful. A symphony o war. ON BIG NICK AND THE COPS -- struggling to get a shot off, keeping pace, stalking the enemy. Nick comes to Borracho, dead. Nick grimaces, pops up and opens fire aggressively. ON DONNIE -- can’t get out of the cuffs. Then he notices something. HAIRGEL. Still smudged on his forearm. ON MURPH -- pressing in on Bosco, as Bosco runs for the neighborhood. Gets shots off, hits Bosco, but absorbed by body armor. Bosco turns on Murph, returns fire. MURPH TAK ROUNDS TO THE SHOULDER AND ARM. He howls in pain and drop (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 155 156 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 115.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bosco reloads, and moves to finish off Murph. Murph fires wild shots, some miss, others stopped by Bosco’s seemingl impenetrable armor. Murph is a fatality in a millisecond. ON TONY Z -- trying to get a clean shot on Bosco, who constantly moves. HE DROPS TO PRONE POSITION, AIMS BENEAT THE CARS AT BOSCO’S SHINS AND FEET. Fires. ON BOSCO -- moving to finish Murph off, when BULLETS TEAR THROUGH HIS SHIN, BLOW UP HIS FIBULA. He screams, drops, finally a stationary target. He sprays the rest of his cl wildly. ON TONY Z -- getting Bosco’s head in his sights. Fires. D BOSCO WITH A KILLSHOT TO THE DOME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MERRIMEN and ENSON -- last men standing. They continue bound and peel, laying down steady fire while in constant motion, putting on a tactical clinic. With the cops takin cover, MERRIMEN AND ENSON RETREAT, SPRINT INTO THE NEIGHBORHOOD. ON NICK, TONY Z, and GUS -- hearing the lull in fire, the take off in pursuit, reload while they run. Fan out to ei side of the street, using cars, anything as cover.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: (to Gus) Flank’em flank’em!

dialogues.speaker: ON GUS
dialogues.text: HUSTLING AND HURDLING WALLS AND FENCES in an effort to pa the enemy, catch them unaware on their blind side. ON MERRIMEN, ENSON -- taking cover behind a vehicle, opening fire on Nick, tearing the street to shreds. Merrimen runs dry.

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: (screams to Merrimen over fire)

dialogues.speaker: MOVE
dialogues.text: Merrimen peels off while Enson continues firing. ON NICK and TONY Z -- in cover as MIND-NUMBING GUNFIRE fi the air. This is URBAN WARFARE; close, frenzied, fast, lo Silence again. They pop up, spot MERRIMEN, ENSON DISAPPEA INTO A SIDEYARD. They chase them into the houses, break o (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 156 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 116.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ON TONY Z -- at street level, moving into and through hou and their backyards. He slows, doesn’t want to make a noi to reveal his position. ON MERRIMEN -- taking quiet cover in a backyard. He silen reloads. Listens for the cops. ON ENSON -- moving slow and quiet through a house. ON NICK -- USES A TRASH CAN TO CLIMB UP ONTO A ROOF. He sweeps yard by yard below, leaps onto the next roof. He inches forward, finger feathering the trigger. ON MERRIMEN -- he slides in his last mag. It clicks quiet ON NICK -- hearing the faint click. He freezes, looks to yard below. Then his eyes land on something. HIS SHADOW. the backyard’s cinderblock wall. He cringes. ON MERRIMEN -- SEES THE SHADOW. Of someone on the roof ab Turns to it, opens fire. BULLETS SHRED THE DRYWALL AND ROOFING. ON NICK -- dives out of the way as bullets puncture throu Runs and jumps down to the sideyard, eats shit. Recovers. Rounds the corner, fires on Merrimen as Merrimen sprints ON ENSON -- slipping out of a house when a MASTIFF barks him, giving up his position. He shoots the dog. Too late. TONY Z FIRES ON ENSON’S POSITION FROM INSIDE A HOUSE. Ens returns fire with the MK48, VIRTUALLY CUTS THE HOUSE IN H Enson runs dry. He’s out. He drops the gun. ON TONY Z -- in a house, flat on the ground. Hears a heav gun clatter to the ground. He bursts outside. Enson is go ON NICK -- hunting Merrimen, sucking in air. Merrimen mov constantly, crossing an alley into a container yard. Nick can’t get a clean shot. Merrimen fires a few rounds, slow Nick. ON TONY Z -- hearing Merrimen’s shots, looking for Enson. spots FLECKS OF BLOOD ON THE GROUND. Follows them. ON ENSON -- moving up an alley, down to his handgun. Exhausted, injured. Blood soaks his pants. Comes to a qui street. No one there. Except for A MAN PARKING HIS CAR. H goes for the car, his ride to freedom, when his eyes wide Gus. Aiming his carbine right at Enson’s exposed head. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 156 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 117.

dialogues.speaker: DROP THE GUN
dialogues.text: Enson doesn’t. So Gus fires. Enson takes a round to his u torso. Drops to a knee, gun falling from his hands. Enson collapses backwards. Blood pours down his arm. Gus rushes Enson, kicks his gun away. Kneels beside him. Color begins to fade from Enson’s face, as he slowly blee out. Sirens can be heard approaching in the distance. A WHISTLE. Gus looks up -- Tony Z, looking to Gus. GUS SIGNALS ENSON IS DONE. Tony Z nods, takes off after Nick. Enson squeezes Gus’ arm, looks to him. Enson’s lips start quiver, and tears pools in his eyes, as he can feel his l slip away. Enson talks weakly.

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: ...look after them, please...

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) I told you to drop it, my brother - Enson squeezes Gus’ arm harder yet, the last of his stren

dialogues.speaker: GUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into radio) I have a suspect with several gunshot wounds, need an ambulance on the corner of MacFarland, and East C street!

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: - my kids... Please... I...shit... Gus clasps Enson’s hand in a gesture of pure humanity.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: I know. It’s ok. You’re in His hands now. Enson’s eyes fill with raw fear. His breaths begin to ras

dialogues.speaker: ENSON
dialogues.text: -.-my my my...shit...shit.... Despite it all, Gus just keeps nodding in comfort, maskin the profound effect this dying man is having upon him.

dialogues.speaker: GUS
dialogues.text: It’s ok. You’re in His hands... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 156 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 118.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gus says a prayer, as Enson takes his last breath. Gus remains there, at his side, as Enson’s soul departs, and sirens near. ON MERRIMEN -- moving from cover to cover through the neighborhood maze of homes, cars, fences and walls. ROUNDS LITE UP HIS POSITION. A few thump into his armor. SPOTS NICK, returns fire, suppressing Nick’s barrage. Rounds from his 9. Tony Z. Merrimen turns on Tony Z, lays down steady bursts. MERRIMEN ALTERNATES FIRING IN A STACC 3 ROUND RHYTHM ON TONY Z AND NICK’S POSITIONS, AS HE RETREATS. Tony Z takes a round to the arm. Screams. Grips his gun-h forearm. Blood gushes between his fingers. He takes cover Merrimen takes cover behind a corner. Quickly reloads, as can hear them moving in. Presses the barrel of his HK416 against the wall’s corner, peeks out, and opens fire on f auto. Nick moves to cover, then unloads on Merrimen’s position. Rounds ping off his gun. The battle is loud and intense, the eardrum piercing fire echoes and reverberate heavily across the neighborhood. Dogs bark. Merrimen runs dry. He ducks back for cover, searches for fresh mag, checking his vest, belt. Can’t find one. HE’S COME IN TIGHT ON MERRIMEN, as this devastating realizatio sets in. He shuts his eyes, then slowly opens them again. He takes in the distant view -- the sprawling Port of LA, commerce’s heart, extends to the horizon. It is lit from below by a sea of vapor lights, above by a hazy, blood re sky. He looks down to the weapon in his blood-flecked hands, a resigns himself to that fact that, his time here, has com an end. Push flowers. And so it shall be... He stands, grips his weapon, then rounds the corner, movi out of cover. Big Nick waits for him there. MERRIMEN WALK DIRECTLY AT NICK, RAISING HIS WEAPON. SO NICK ENDS IT.

dialogues.speaker: NICK FIRES MULTIPLE ROUNDS INTO MERRIMEN. SEVERAL FIND TH
dialogues.text: MARK. Merrimen collapses to the ground. Nick stands over Merrimen. Merrimen takes short, shallow breaths. He says something to Nick, his voice barely a whisper:

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: ...told you... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 156 157 158 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 119.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nick meets eyes with Merrimen, then nods. Watches as Merrimen’s breathing slows, and body goes slack. Nick rea down, checks Merrimen’s pulse. RAY MERRIMEN IS DEAD.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: .+-yeah you did. Tony Z comes over, looks down at Merrimen, motions to his

dialogues.speaker: TONY Z
dialogues.text: No mag. Dead man’s gun...He was empty. Nick picks up Merrimen’s weapon, checks the chamber. Inde it is. He and Tony share a knowing look. Suicide by cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crime scene has been cordoned off, the traffic moved A sheet covers Borracho’s body. ON BIG NICK -- opens his truck’s door, tosses his gear inside, then freezes. A PAIR OF HAND-CUFFS DANGLE FROM TH DOOR HANDLE, with no one attached to them. DONNIE IS GONE. Nick spins, searches the area. Donnie’s nowhere to be see

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: What?!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick searches Merrimen’s truck, sifts through extra ammo the travel docs. He opens the rear doors. ZIPS OPEN THE

dialogues.speaker: OVERSIZED CANVAS BAGS THERE, FINDS THE MONEY BRICKS INSID
dialogues.text: Tony Z comes up, arm bandaged. Nick pulls a knife from hi belt, rips into one of the bricks.

dialogues.text: Do those. Tony Z does the same, tearing apart the other bricks. One one, THE MONEY BRICKS BREAK APART INTO THOUSANDS OF TINY

dialogues.speaker: CONFETTI.
dialogues.text: But not one banknote. Not one note of legal tender. Nothi IT’S ALL SHREDDED CASH. ALL OF IT. Nick stares at it in disbelief. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 158 159 160 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 120.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BIG NICK (CONT’D) So they were gonna make fucking snow globes? Like, 10,000 of them? Tony Z just shakes his head in surrender.

dialogues.speaker: TONY Z
dialogues.text: You gonna call Borracho’s wife? (Nick sighs deeply, nods) .--all right. I’m going home. Nick leans against the Suburban, exhausted, and rubs his temples. Tony Z leaves. Nick watches as he goes, looks ou over the vast crime scene, and just stands there a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PUSHES IN SLOWLY ON NICK, who sits alone on the fa side of the otherwise empty office. Nick finishes up a so conversation with Borracho’s wife, hangs up. Nick sits slumped at his desk, looking at the crime wall. photos tacked up there of suspects Merrimen, Enson, and Bosco, have big red Xs struck across them. Only one doesn’t. Donnie’s. Nick stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same lurky characters. Ziggy’s behind the bar tonight. Ni walks in, looks for Donnie. Doesn’t see him. Approaches Ziggy:

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Donnie around?

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: No. He qvit two days ago.

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY
dialogues.text: No. I said, he qvit. Nick takes a seat at the bar, projecting defeat. His head sinks into his hands.

dialogues.speaker: ZIGGY, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: 160 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 121.

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Very much so. Beer. You pick. Ziggy pours the beer. Nick takes a long sip. His eyes wan over behind the bar. To the little SIGN that reads, “Loos lips sink ships.” Nick stares at it for a second. Then his eyes move over to the PHOTO OF THE SOCCER TEAM, “HOFBRAU” emblazoned on the players’ jerseys. Nick notice something. One of the players on the team, IS DONNIE. Nic looks closer. Next to Donnie is someone else who looks familiar. Nick squints his eyes. IT’S BOSCO, THE GOALIE. Next to Bosco is a black guy. MACK. ALL ON THE SAME TEAM. A SOUND to his left. LAUGHTER. Nick looks. Four people en TWO ARE LUIGI AND JUNIOR. They all wear their ID TAGS on their shirts. As they pass by him, Nick gets a closer loo The tags read, “FEDERAL RESERVE BANK, LOS ANGELES BRANCH. Nick looks around the bar -- uniformed men sit in one cor The PATCHES on their uniforms read, “Secret Service. Fede Reserve Bank.” One of them is JACKSON. In another corner, more ID tags. CAM, JOHNNY, others. Laughing, drinking, relaxing after work. At the end of th bar -- BRINKS ARMED GUARDS, and AL, the Brinks secretary. Then it hits him -- EVERYBODY IN THIS BAR WORKS AT THE FE Nick’s eyes go to a PLACARD with DONNIE’S PHOTO on it. Be his photo are the words, “Employee of the year: 2010, 201 COME IN ON NICK'S DUMBSTRUCK FACE. QUICK CUTS OF NICK’S FLASHBACK POV --— * Donnie, behind the bar, serving Nick a drink.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: .»+-You put a few drinks in a man, a nice steak on his plate, a couple of women walking around...It all comes out. + DONNIE, tending bar at the Hofbrau. Bosco seated there, putting down the Cuba Libres. THIS TIME, THE SCENE IS HEA

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you guys are looking to get into something, I got a score that’s ripe.

dialogues.speaker: BOSCO
dialogues.text: ..-what kind? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: 160 Den of Thieves February 6, 2016 Draft 122.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: The really profitable kind. (they share a look) Can you make an intro? + DONNIE, at the “POMONA MINING CO.” RESTAURANT, sitting Merrimen. Bosco waits in the b.g.:

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: Why’d you come to me?

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: Heard you’re the only one who can pull this off.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: .-.if we do this, I bring in my crimeys. And as far as they’re concerned, this is my job. Not yours. Just the way it has to be.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: I have no problem with that... * DONNIE, at Holly’s place, pouring over everything Donni culled at the Hofbrau -- SCHEMATICS, HAND-DRAWN MAPS ON B NAPKINS, photographs of the Fed. Merrimen is amazed.

dialogues.speaker: MERRIMEN
dialogues.text: How did you get ahold of all of this?

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: Collected it. Over time. + a SERIES OF RAPID CUTS of DONNIE TENDING BAR, TALKING T DIFFERENT PEOPLE -- Brinks Armed Guards; Jackson; Monroe; Secret Service Guards; Johnny; Doris... + CAM, DRAWING A MAP of the FED’S VENTILATION SYSTEM on a NAPKIN and explaining it to Donnie. + JUNIOR and LUIGI, drunk off their ass, explaining to Do how the counting machines work. BACK TO NICK, at the Hofbrau. He turns to the man next to at the bar. Wolfgang. Wolfgang jabbers away drunkenly to Ziggy.

dialogues.speaker: WOLFGANG
dialogues.text: (whispers) .-.-I tell you, somebody, if zey ver smart, vould rob the place during von of zese blackouts. It vould vork. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He STARES AT THE SOCCER TEAM PHOTO. Looks at the other players on the team. Sees the waste-management guys -- BA and ALEXI. + DONNIE AND BAS -- loading SOILED CELLO-PHANE BRICKS int the HULL OF AN ORANGE WASTE-MANAGEMENT TRUCK. + ALEXI, DRIVING THE WASTE MANAGEMENT TRUCK, seeing Bosco the black Suburban behind him. He bangs a right. AN IDENT ORANGE WASTE-MANAGEMENT TRUCK WAITS THERE. As Alexi passe he looks over to BAS, BEHIND THE WHEEL OF THE SECOND TRUC As Bas pulls out onto the street, Alexi disappears onto a side street. GONE. + BOSCO -- pulling Bas from the Waste-Management Truck. + DONNIE -- with Mack, Bas and Alexi, loading the REAL MO BRICKS into Samsonites. COME IN ON the protruding zip-loc They prep the Samsonites to be shipped. COME IN ON the ADDRESS -- “ST. MAARTEN. Virgin Islands.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DONNIE sits at the desk of the BANK MANAGER. The Samsonit lie behind the desk.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: I'd like to open five separate accounts...

dialogues.text: Donnie exits. Approaches 4 people -- MACK, BAS, ALEXI, AN DORIS. Hands them each a “Credit Lyonnaise” envelope.

dialogues.speaker: DORIS
dialogues.text: Never eating Chinese again. That’s for goddamn sure.

dialogues.speaker: DONNIE
dialogues.text: (chuckles, puts on sunglasses) .+-Have a good life. They walk off in separate directions, disappear into the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nick walks out of the bar, in a daze. He looks down the street. And there it is -- THE FED, JUST TWO BLOCKS AWAY. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BIG NICK
dialogues.text: Fraulein...

dialogues.text: A SHIFT CHANGE is taking place, as uniformed night-shift DEBEERS SECURITY enter, while the day-shift exits. COME I one of the Security Guards, CONNOR, 42, as he leaves work Connor walks out onto the sidewalk before this imposing, formidable building. A placard on the building reads -- “

dialogues.speaker: CHARTERHOUSE STREET. DEBEERS DIAMONDS. WORLD HEADQUARTERS

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: Oi! A CHORUS of “Oi’s” in return from the DRUNKEN BLOKES at t bar. ALL WEARING THE SAME DEBEERS SECURITY UNIFORMS AS CONNOR. Connor steps to the bar. Hollers to the BARKEEP:

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey gov! Get a couple of pints of best for me mates, eh?!

dialogues.speaker: BARKEEP
dialogues.text: With pleasure, mate. We don’t see the Barkeep, only hear him. Accent is thick, it sounds vaguely familiar. His hand comes into frame, sliding the pints to Connor.

dialogues.speaker: BARKEEP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And for yourself? Connor can’t decide. He’s easy.

dialogues.speaker: CONNOR
dialogues.text: I’m easy, gov. Whatever. Surprise me! Reveal the Barkeep. IT’S DONNIE. Although we hardly recog him. He’s adapted. Donnie looks directly at us, grins. And why shouldn't he. (CONTINUED)
